title: Front-End/Web Developer
description:
At Neota, we are pioneers in no-code automation. Our technology empowers customers to fundamentally transform how they work and how they deliver services, with the result being business automation solutions delivering outcomes of much better quality, far greater consistency, and of astronomical scale compared to traditional or otherwise manual ways of working.We believe that our greatest asset is the people behind our platform. That technology is most powerful when driven by purpose. Our no-code platform is a game-changer for legal, procurement, risk and compliance professionals and we are always looking for curious minds and results-oriented professionals to join us.We are looking for a front-end developer that will help us implement major advancements to Neota's platform. As a front-end developer, you will be responsible for creating tools for developing beautiful, cross-browser, and responsive interfaces using modern web technologies. Among other things, you will collaborate in development using TypeScript and React, among other technologies, for creation of innovative no-code web tools.Responsibilities:Implementing major advancements to Neota's no-code platform for creating intelligent, expert system and automation. applications,Creating tools for developing beautiful, cross-browser, and responsive interfaces using modern web technologies,Maintaining internal and external facing web infrastructure.RequirementsQualifications:3+ years of professional experience working with modern web technologies (React, TypeScript, JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, AJAX, and the like),Experience building tools for website development,Knowledge of Object Oriented development and functional languagesUnderstanding of relational databases and data modelsExperience in mobile development and responsive design (preferred),The ability to come up to speed quickly and thrive in an environment rich in complexity,Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and solutions in a clear and organized manner,The ability to work independently and achieve established goals with minimal supervision,Attention to detail and penchant for neat architectures,Passion for designing excellent user experiences!Requirements:React,TypeScript/JavaScript,HTML5,CSS3,AJAX,Responsive DesignFluency in Git.Knowledge of the following skills and technologies is a plus:GraphQL,WordPress,eslint,Nx/webpack/Snowpack,CKEditor.BenefitsWe value our employees’ time and efforts. We work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, with flexible working conditions and an encouraging environment where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.

title: Front End Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionWe're a team of researchers, designers, engineers, architects, innovators and change makers.We help transform organisations by building design led, digital solutions. For 12+ years we have worked with some of Australia’s biggest brands, delivering innovative experiences on both mobile and the latest in emerging technology.With offices in both Sydney and Melbourne, Bilue is driven by its mission to 'mobilise millions'. We strive for technical excellence, but we thrive on human connection. We support one another to challenge ourselves and our clients in the pursuit of continuous improvement. We’re welcoming, fun and we value the experience and knowledge of our mates.OverviewJob DescriptionFront End Engineers at Bilue are responsible for combining the art of design with the art of programming to produce innovative and high quality products.We develop clean quality code that matches our clients vision. We iterate constantly to get the best possible outcome for all parties. We deploy products that add real value and which we are proud of. Roles & Responsibilities:Work collaboratively with designers, developers, product managers and clients in an agile environment Translate the UI/UX design wireframes to actual code that will produce visual elements of the application. Work with the design team in order to bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the application looks as well as how it worksDevelop new user-facing featuresBuild reusable code and libraries for future useEnsure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designsOptimise application for maximum performance and scalabilityAssure that all user input is validated before submitting to back-endSkills:Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASSProficient understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks, including jQueryGood understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as AngularJS, KnockoutJS, BackboneJS, ReactJS, DurandalJS etcGood understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAXBasic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to crop, resize, or perform small adjustments on an image. Familiarity with tools such as Gimp or Photoshop is a plusProficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around themGood understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to themAbility to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirementsFamiliarity with cloud message APIs and push notificationsA knack for benchmarking and optimizationProficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as GitFamiliarity with Unit TestingFamiliarity with continuous integration and continuous deliveryFamiliarity working with Agile Framework principles (Relative Estimation, Task breakdown, Sprint cadences) Additional InformationCandidates must be located in either Sydney or Melbourne Employee benefits include (to name a few):A flexible 'work from anywhere' approachMonthly office allowanceAnnual personal development budget12 month subscription to the Centr Fitness and Wellness AppBirthday leaveFree access to counselling support as well as financial, wellbeing and nutritional coachingPaid parental leave (regardless of who is the primary carer)Monthly social budgetCasual dress code

title: Frontend Developer
description:

Lumachain is developing a complex computer vision-based Artificial Intelligence platform in a highly collaborative environment.This is a great opportunity to immerse yourself in the culture of a global company, leading the way in the latest technology that is experiencing hypergrowth in Australia, the US, Europe and Asia.About the RoleWe are looking for a mid-level Front End Developer who will be responsible for the design and implementation of new systems and features, as well as modifying existing systems for adaptation to business and / or technology changes.Tech Stack: Angular, Azure, JavascriptKey ResponsibilitiesDesigning and implementing user interfaces, integrating back-end APIs, and ensuring that applications are optimized for performance and securityThe applications will be developed in an Agile working environment and will require strong grasp of modern front-end development languages including HTML, CSS, SCSS, JavaScript, AngularStrong debugging and troubleshooting skillsUnderstanding of browser compatibility issues and how to handle themGood understanding of performance optimisation techniquesExperience3 + years experience in a fast-paced and agile environmentHands-on development expertise with JavaScript, HTML5, React, Angular and any CSS pre-processor like SCSS or LESSVery good knowledge of TypeScriptKnowledge of source control systems (we use Azure Devops)Experienced with TDD and writing test casesIntegration with RESTful APIsCommercial experience UX/UI design is a bonusGood communication, presentation, organisational skills; including the ability to manage changing priorities and meeting deadlines

title: Junior Front-end Developer
description:
Job Status  : Full-Time, Ongoing Salary  : Base salary of $80,619 per annum, plus 10.5% superannuation contributions Position No:  SOH2119 Applications Close:  Tuesday 14 th March 2023, 11:59pm Role Enquiries:  recruitment@sydneyoperahouse.com Technical Enquiries:  Jobs NSW Helpdesk on 1800 562 679 An organisation where diversity of thought & experience is valued, supported & respected.  THE HOUSE At the Sydney Opera House you will be surrounded by supportive and hardworking teams who are filled with passion and creativity. You will be inspired to create value in everything you do and will be provided with opportunities to grow and achieve while making a positive contribution to our community. Our vision for diversity, inclusion and belonging (DI&B) is that the Sydney Opera House – who we are and everything we do – reflects and respects the diversity of the community. Our 2021-23 DI&B Strategy sets out the change we are driving in the lead up to our 50 th anniversary in 2023. These commitments work hand in hand with the commitments in our longstanding Reconciliation , Accessibility and Environmental Action Plans.We welcome and encourage applications from First Nations people, recognising the value, unique skills and knowledge that First Nations employees bring to the workplace. We encourage applications from people of all genders, as well as people from one or more of these underrepresented groups/communities, including but not limited to d/Deaf and Disabled people/people with disability, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and people who identify as LGBTIQ+.We recognise that everyone is unique, and that you might require some adjustments to ensure you have the best opportunity to apply and put your skills forward for consideration. If we can make some adjustments to the SOH recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, then please email us at recruitment@sydneyoperahouse.com or call us on 02 9250 7743 and let us know. Adjustments may include but are not limited to; alternate application methods, interview setup, physical requirements, guidance for trans or gender diverse applicants, interpreters or other access supports or specific interview availability times and more.For more information about the Sydney Opera House please refer to our website . YOUR NEW ROLE This position develops and maintains the front-end codebase for sydneyoperahouse.com and its associated applications. It works with internal specialists to and outside agencies to help provide a frictionless customer experience.Further detailed information about the role and its requirements can be obtained from the role description. ARE YOU THE ONE? We Are Looking For Someone With Front-end web development experience, including demonstrated HTML, CSS, and JavaScript ability.  Strong communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem-solving ability.  Flexibility and a commitment to continuous improvement. Desirable Experience with front-end frameworks, formats, and libraries such as React and Bootstrap.  Experience with Git and Webpack.  Experience developing for Drupal CMS.  Experience with software testing methods and frameworks such as Jest and Cypress. Benefits & CultureBeing Australia’s premier cultural institution, tourism destination & a celebrated community meeting place, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and dynamic working environment for all our staff. With values of Safety, Creativity, Excellence, Collaboration & Accountability your professional life is provided with every opportunity to succeed and develop in your chosen profession. Working with the Sydney Opera House gives you access to a great range of benefits including: Flexible working arrangements  5 weeks annual leave  Access to a range of internal and external professional development programs and staff engagement initiatives  Staff community groups like SOH Pride, First Nations Staff Network, Sustainable Environmental Action Leaders (aka ‘SEALs’) and more.  Fitness Passport & complimentary wellbeing programs including pilates, yoga, circuit classes, physiotherapy sessions as well as other wellbeing initiatives  Working for an organisation with a 5 Star Green Star Performance Rating from the Green Building Council of Australia (GBCA)  Working for an organisation who has committed to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals  And many more!  SOUND LIKE YOU? APPLY! Applicants are asked to include the following documents with their applications Up to date resume of no more than five pages  Address their suitability in a cover letter of no more than one page In addition, applicants will be prompted to answer the following two targeted questions in the online application platform. The Sydney Opera House is one of the world's busiest performing arts venues and aims for excellence in online customer engagement. Please outline how you think your skills and experience will assist you in contributing to Sydney Opera House web development.  As a Front-end Developer you will have created or contributed to an array of exciting projects. Tell us about the one you are most proud of and why? Applicants are required to create a profile and submit their application electronically for this position at https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/ .  Only applicants who apply online and include the requested documentation will be considered for this position  , unless otherwise discussed.To be eligible to apply for this position, applicants must have existing Australian work rights. Any offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Check and Pre-Employment Health Assessment . The assessment seeks information only relevant to performing the inherent requirements of the job, it remains strictly confidential and applicants will be informed of the result.This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.Applications will not be accepted from recruitment agencies.

title: Front-end Developer
description:
At Fastmail, we’re building a better future for the internet. We are creating this through our commitment to advancing open standards and user privacy. When the vast majority of people get email for free, our users choose us because they value both privacy and a great user experience. Our podcast, Digital Citizen, provides listeners with actionable advice about digital citizenship in their lives and our open source projects power email applications and more across the world.We’re searching for a mid level front-end developer to join our team. You’ll work with our collaborative team of developers, designers, and researchers to improve our customers’ experience, keeping it secure and a delight to use. We work together to write code that is optimised for in-browser speed and resilience. Our web app has to stay responsive while interacting with a sometimes-wayward server. The network isn’t reliable, latency is non-zero, and every missed data binding means one more bizarre state that the interface can enter. There’s always an interesting new challenge to solve!We use the tools the browser provides. Our interfaces are built in JavaScript, on our own Overture framework and the JMAP network standard. This gives us full control from top to bottom to build the right solutions.RequirementsMuch of what we do is bespoke so the most important attribute for success in this role is a willingness to learn and ask questions. The Fastmail web client is a complete network application running in the browser. You'll be learning many parts of the web API that often look cool but don't get used: IndexedDB, web workers, push, and the list goes on. As a web client for real standards, you'll also learn the web, calendar, and contact standards as they are, without lossy mediation by a third party web service API.You’re comfortable working with marketing, design and product managers to collaborate on feature development. You enjoy engaging with your colleagues to find the ideal solution. Experience with design systems is a bonus.You strive to find root causes and apply the fix at the right level of the stack; this includes reading other people’s code and determining why it exists before making changes. You delight in an elegant solution, especially if it makes the user’s experience faster. We take pride in the little details, and we hope you do too.You have excellent written language skills for async communication, strong verbal and interpersonal skills for collaborating in person, patience, diligence, and an ability to gracefully adapt to change.If this sounds like you and you’re not sure if you have enough experience, we encourage you to apply and have a chat with us.BenefitsThis is a full time hybrid role. And, like everyone on our team, you’ll get great benefits.4 weeks paid parental leave at full salaryannual professional development budget to fund your own growthopportunities to travel to our sister office in Philadelphia, a historic US city!dedicated time to contribute to open source, internet standards, and conference talksThis job is based in Melbourne CBD. We have a strong in-person culture and are looking for someone who will be on-site and part of that culture. We aim to be in the office 3 days a week and you are welcome to work your remaining schedule at home or in the office. We also offer further remote flexibility for life events.We’re in close communication with our colleagues in Philadelphia. This means that you’ll need to be available for an hour or two of morning calls (from 8am) each week. We are partners, parents and caregivers ourselves, and we understand time-zone flexibility goes in both directions. Talk to us if you’re unsure.We encourage employees to write and speak about the great work we do, and to stay engaged with their professional peers. Many staff members choose to attend conferences for learning and networking, and several staff members are regular conference speakers.You can read about our values, and our blog contains interviews with some of the people who will become your colleagues at Fastmail.We welcome all applicants regardless of race, colour, religion, age, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, disability, or sexual orientation. The thing we can’t help with is a visa or sponsorship. You must already have the right to work in the Australia.

description:

title: Frontend Developer
description:
Are you an experienced Front-End Developer looking for an exciting opportunity to work with a boutique socially driven and digital business? The Nudge Group is thrilled to be partnering with this awesome digital agency, built on creativity, innovation, and technology. We are seeking a talented Mid Level Front-End Developer to join our tight-knit and collaborative team.As a Mid Level Front-End Developer, you will work collaboratively with your team to develop and implement digital solutions for our clients. You will be responsible for developing responsive and intuitive user interfaces for web and mobile applications. You will build reusable code and libraries for future use, optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability, and ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs. You will collaborate with back-end developer and stakeholders to ensure seamless integration with server-side logic. Additionally, you will stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in web development.The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of experience in Front-End Development, with a strong understanding of web development principles and best practices is crucial for success in this role. We are open to candidates on a permanent or contract basis. This is an exciting opportunity for a mid level front end developer to join a dynamic team and work across a range of cool portfolios. Apply now and become a part of our growing team, or reach out to me directly at jess@thenudgegroup.com

title: React JS Developer
description:
Job DescriptionAbout Infosys:Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.If your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for youBrief about the role.Over 8 + years of IT experience which includes 3+ years of Extensive experience as a React JS Developer and 3 years of Experience as a UI/UX Developer /API developerExtensive experience in developing web pages and single page app using HTML/HTML5, DHTML CSS3, JavaScript, React JS 16 +, Redux, Node.js, express.js, JESTExperienced in MERN stack development Mongo dB, Express.js, Node, and ReactJS.Experience in all phases of SDLC like Requirement Analysis, Implementation and Maintenance, and extensive experience with Agile and SCRUM.Extensive knowledge in developing single - page applications (SPAs).Working knowledge of Web protocols and standards REST, SSO etc.Good Expertise in development and debugging tools such as VSCode, git, npm, chrome developer tools,Familiar with creating Custom Reusable React Components Library.Involved in writing application-level code to interact with APIs, RESTful Web Services using AJAX, JSON.Knowledge of utilizing cloud technologies including Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure Blob and Pivotal Cloud Foundry (PCF).Expertise in RESTful services to integrate between Application to ApplicationExperience with front-end development with back-end system integration.Proficient in using JEST framework for unit testingGood Experience in Bug tracking tools like JIRA, HP Quality CenterAbility to work effectively while working as a team member as well as individually.Excellent communication and Inter-Personal Skills, well organized, goal oriented.Your Key ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the estimation of work product in order to provide right information to TL/PM for overall project estimationUnderstand the requirements both functional and non-functional by going through the specifications and with inputs from business analysts and participate in creating high level estimate as well as translating the same to systems requirements in order to create a systems requirements document and participate effectively in the design, development and testing phases of the projectDevelop and review artifacts (Code, Documentation, Unit test scripts) conduct reviews for self and peers, conduct unit test and document unit test results for complex programs in order to build the application and make it ready for validation/deliveryRequired QualificationsBachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.At least 8 years of experience in Information Technology.Australian citizens and those authorized to work in Sydney are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time.At least 3 years of experience in as a React JS Developer and 3 years of Experience as a UI/UX Developer /API developerPreferred QualificationsAt least Web Technologies: HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, AJAX, jQuery, JSON, React JS, Express JS, Node.js, GitDevelopment tools: VSCodeDebugging tools: Chrome Developer Tools.Frameworks: React JS, Node JS.Platforms: WindowsMethodologies: AgileExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExperience in software development life cycleAbility to work in team in diverse/ multiple stakeholder environmentExperience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.What’s in it for you?We are not just a technology company full of people, we’re a people company full of technology. It is people like you who make us what we are today. Welcome to our world: Our people, our culture, our voices, and our passions. What’s better than building the next big thing? It’s doing so while never letting go of the little things that matter. None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment in which to do them, one where ideas can flourish, and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you. This is something we achieve through cultivating a culture of inclusiveness and openness, and a mindset of exploration and applied innovation. A career at Infosys means experiencing and contributing to this environment every day. It means being a part of a dynamic culture where we are united by a common purpose: to navigate further, together.EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/National OriginAt Infosys, we recognize that everyone has individual requirements. If you are a person with disability, illness or injury and require adjustments to the recruitment and selection process, please contact our Recruitment team for adjustment only on Infosys_ta@infosys.com or include your preferred method of communication in email and someone will be in touch.Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process, Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. description:

title: Web Developer
description:
LEAP Legal Software is a multinational Legal Tech company that develops integrated productivity solutions for the legal profession including practice management, case management, document management, accounting, and legal publishing, as well as client and lawyer collaboration tools.LEAP has more than 600 employees in offices throughout Canada, the United States, Australia, the United Kingdom and New Zealand. LEAP supports the software needs of more than 25,000 law firms and has more than 10,000 firms using its flagship cloud product, LEAP.LEAP will provide you with the best training, equipment, mentoring and support that we are capable of to optimise the chances of you being successful. But being successful in this role depends on you.We employ people who can get things done and will appreciate being part of an accountable, high-performance culture.The Global Marketing team’s role at LEAP is to protect our brands, monitor quality across all regions, launch new products, features and companies whilst maintaining excellence in everything we do.As a Web Developer, you will support the Web Development Manager and Global Marketing team to deliver and maintain exceptional websites for LEAP and its related brands.RequirementsResponsibilities and Duties (including but not limited to)Assist with Management, updates, design, and scaling of company websites globallyLiaise with developers globally to assist with queries and ensure best practicesImprove existing website design and functionality using reporting, analysis, and monitoring tools.Write logical, testable, efficient code by using best web development practicesBuild and maintain website layout/user interface by using best HTML/CSS practicesCooperate with design team to match visual design intentCreate and maintain documentation of website practicesMonitor, fix, and resolve website issues in a timely mannerRequirementsQUALIFICATIONS: 1-2+ years in a similar role; title: ReactJS Developer
description:
About UsInfosys is a leading provider of next-generation consulting, technology and outsourcing solutions. We are dedicated to helping organizations, in over 30 countries; build tomorrow’s enterprise and advance the way the world works. That's why Forbes ranks us 19th among the top 100 most innovative companies. Our 150,000+ employees partner with clients to transform their business - one conversation; one idea; one insight at a time. While we are at it, some things remain unchanged: the unwavering ethics, transparency and respect behind everything we do. We will always be a company powered by intellect and driven by values. So, if your passion is to build solutions that really make a difference to enterprises, the community and your world, Infosys is the right place for you. Role – TL or Senior ConsultantLocation – MelbourneShort Description – The Consultant is responsible for implementing the given Architecture, by selecting right design patterns and principles and then leading the implementation phase till transition in to BAU. He/She is also expected to be well versed on leading technology teams in the delivery of challenging technical solutions for clients in various industries. The Lead is expected to have demonstrable implementation experience of leading digital/online/ & integration and API development projects. Roles and ResponsibilitiesWork in client-facing roles to contribute towards the end-to-end delivery lifecycle of complex and large-scale technology solutions.Hands-on Lead providing technology guidance to the implementation team throughout the life cycle of a project.Hands-on solution and application interface design using cutting edge web and digital Technologies.Defines solution architecture based on the requirements (Both Functional and Non Functional)Develops designs to support the functionality and documented protocols as specified in the solution architecture and developer stories.Lead and manage resources at on-shore, off-shore from technology perspective; able to work with architects, designers & developersEnsuring software developed is held to quality standards through code and design reviews.In addition to billable engagements, contribute towards account strategy initiatives.Ability to work independently with minimal assistanceExcellent leadership and communication skills to efficiently manage client stake holders and Infosys internal teams.Skills /CompetenciesShould have working experience inJava 8 or aboveReactJsRestful WebservicesSpringboot microservicesAWS: serverless computing (lambda, stepfunctions, Glue), RDS, DynamoDB, S3, SQS,Understanding of Agile way of working.Should have atleast 6-7 years of working experienceExperience in Source Control (e.g. Git, Bitbucket, etc), Continuous Integration (e.g. Jenkins, Bamboo, etc), Deployment & Delivery (CI/CD) practices, including defining pipelinesEducational Qualifications:Engineering Bachelors or master’s degree level or equivalentInfosys is an equal opportunity employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of gender or other attribute covered by equal opportunity legislation.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Bare is focused on bringing end-of-life planning into the digital age and, along the way, making a real impact on people at a time in their lives that really matters.A brief overviewSince launching in 2019 we've grown exponentially. Bare started out as a direct-to-consumer funeral home offering a digitally enabled, low cost funeral service. We've since expanded to become Australia's leading provider of prepaid funerals, online wills, online estate planning and pet funerals. Our vision is to become the end-of-life CRM, supporting individuals and families deal with a difficult topic in an empathic, affordable and sustainable way.The exciting part? The journey has only just started. We are backed by some of Australia's highest profile investors, are currently one of the fastest growing companies in Australia, and we're committed to making a difference. Join us on the ground floor, and be intimately involved in the creation and development of a product that is category-leading.Bare Frontend EngineerWe are looking for a Frontend Engineer with 3+ years experience building web-based applications with technologies like Javascript, React, Ruby on Rails and AWS. You'll be working in a cross functional product team and focused on designing and developing products that are flexible, scalable, and reusable. We put in place a best-practice modern software engineering environment (end-to-end automated testing, automated infrastructure provisioning) and look forward to your help to make sure we are an engineering group as performant as the best ones out there.What you can expect in a Frontend Engineer role at Bare:Develop features and shape the Bare product in a secure, well-tested, and performant wayWork with Product Management and other stakeholders (Backend, Design, etc.) to iterate on new features within the Bare productCollaborate with other frontend engineers and help define our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code reviewConfidently ship features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projectsWork within a 100% remote, cross functional product team to make a real difference - our customers are incredibly grateful for the service we provideRequirementsProfessional experience with modern JavaScript web frameworks (React, Vue, Angular, Ember, etc) and static site generatorsA solid understanding of semantic HTML, CSS, and core JavaScript conceptsComfort working in a highly agile, intensely iterative software development processPositive and solution-oriented mindsetAn inclination towards communication, inclusion, and visibilitySelf-motivated and self-managing, with strong organisational skillsDemonstrated ability to work closely with other parts of the organisationAbility to thrive in a fully remote organisationCaring about high-engineering quality, and how to marry that with a high and sustainable development speed.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
Why join MagicBrief?At MagicBrief our mission is to become the tool makers for a generation of businesses, enabling creative teams and entrepreneurs to scale their brands. We’re looking for a skilled Frontend Engineer to help us deliver product that businesses are relying on to grow.We’re backed by the best, including Blackbird, Archangel and a talented group of individuals, including the founders of Vimeo, UsTwo, Eucalyptus, Spriggy & Halter.About The RoleWe’re still early in the MagicBrief journey, but our customer base is growing rapidly, and our product roadmap is substantial. If you want to get in on the ground floor and make a significant impact on the development of the product, this is the role for you.You'll be an integral part of our engineering team, working directly with our founding team. You'll have a significant impact on our product and help shape our future.We're an engineering-led organisation and offer an excellent work environment with a modern tech stack that includes full CI/CD, a fully supported local development environment (frontend and back), in-depth code reviews and mentorship.We use a modern stack for design and development, including Notion, Linear and Figma.We also dedicate 10% of our Engineering time to internal itches, including improving pipeline performance, building developer tools, improving infrastructure and paying down technical debt before it becomes a drag on the organisation and contributing back to open source.We use TypeScript and build scalable systems so we can continuously make progress on a solid foundation. We don’t expect you to have a background in everything we use, but we do expect strong JavaScript fundamentals and a background working with React, and, ideally, TypeScript.What You’ll DoWork closely with founders and design to implement fast new feature conceptsBuilding new user-facing features with beautiful and scalable UI componentsImproving application performance by profilingDesign and develop the frontend of the company's software products using modern technologies such as React,Collaborate with other engineers, designers, and stakeholders to build highly-performant, scalable, and responsive user interfacesImplement and maintain test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processesAct as a technical expert and mentor to other team membersParticipate in code reviews and ensure that the code is maintainable, scalable, and follows best practicesStay up-to-date with the latest web development technologies, trends and best practicesWork with the product team to identify and implement new features and improvements to the softwareTechTypescriptNodeExpressDockerPostgresRedisPrismatRPC (if you don’t know this, you’ll learn to love it quickly)ReactTailwind (& Tailwind UI)RequirementsStrong experience with JavaScript and web development best practices. A minimum of 3 years of experience in web development, with at least 2 years of experience building user interfaces using modern frontend frameworks such as React,Strong experience with HTML, CSS and modern web technologies such as Webpack, etc. Experience with implementing and maintaining test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processes. Strong problem-solving skills, ability to think creatively, and ability to adapt to new technologiesStrong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a teamStrong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentWhat We OfferInteresting and challenging workA super supportive teamCompetitive salary and equityDirect involvement with the founders, gives you a chance to have a tangible impact on the company's futureCentral city officeFantastic opportunities for personal and professional growthA chance to work on a product that helps people’s businesses grow and succeedAn engineering-led culture where you will be a core part of the teamWe believe that as an early-stage company, working together in person gives us a competitive edge by letting us move faster and make decisions together on the fly. We also appreciate the importance of deep work, and we are set on building a culture that facilitates it.If you’ve gotten this far in the job ad and think this is for you, come make some magic. We want someone who reads the whole brief and sweats the details for this role.

title: Web Developer
description:
Dabble is an online sports and racing bookmaker (licensed by the NTRC), formed in 2020 and embracing the scaleup journey. Our aim is to disrupt the game with a truly immersive socialized betting experience designed to provide evolutionary entertainment to our punters via genuine interaction and engagement. Our brand ethos, “share the experience”, means we believe in community and celebration - both in the app and in the office!We have office hubs in Darwin, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Albury - and expansion is in our sights. We believe in remote-first work, though in the spirit of our community encourage our people to take advantage of our national network, with cross-office sponsored flights on offer all year round. We are a team of highly driven enthusiasts, and we are looking for our next Dabbler to join us as we continue in our journey.Dabble CultureDress for your day so you can focus on what mattersSwitch up your office, work from home, work from wherever helps you to deliverGenuine, like-minded team of visionaries. We welcome ideas big and small!Scheduled focus time to encourage deep thoughtOur annual convention, DabbleCon, brings us all together to celebrate our successes and plan continued evolution over the coming yearEach day is led through upholding our core Values: Fun, Celebratory, Community, EvolutionaryDabble PerksA minimum of five weeks of paid annual leave for all DabblersPaid parental leave for both primary and secondary caregiverWe encourage you to visit our network of offices: sponsored flights available to staff and spouse/immediate familyFlexibility with working hours to accommodate our cross-country employee base: you are free to manage your own timeYour mental health is our genuine concern: we keep a dedicated psychologist on the booksUp to 10% annual cash bonus based on Company performance metricsDabble Day Dividend: all Dabblers split the day’s revenue evenly on our birthday each year. You share the workload, why shouldn’t you share the reward?Safety first: your ride home from company sponsored events and your flu jab is on usOverviewThe Web Developer will maintain, develop and implement all website-related requirements for Dabble’s marketing department. Reporting to the General Manager Digital Marketing, this full-time position will be responsible for maintaining and developing Dabble-owned websites, acting as Technical Lead during MarTech procurement, and collaborating with the Technology and Product departments on MarTech projects. This is an exciting role that will allow the successful candidate to expand their MarTech and Mobile App Development skills and knowledge.Primary LocationThis role is currently open to all locations within Australia, however candidates based in Melbourne may be preferred.Responsibilities: Web Development Maintain and develop Dabble’s Content Management System (CMS);Implement design revisions to Dabble-owned websites;Maintain and integrate all website scripts, tags, and pixels;Manage tag manager tool, including creating new tags and triggers;Manage web analytics tool, including creating new events and conversions;Maintain Register of relevant SDKs and APIs and coordinate updates with Tech department;Implement technical SEO fixes discovered in weekly SEO audits.MarTech Project Management Scope and document potential projects;Sit in on meetings with potential MarTech vendors, acting as Technical Lead;Collaborate with the Product team to write and rank tickets;Liaise with MarTech vendors and Product team to coordinate MarTech implementations.Skills & QualificationsExperience with headless CMS;Experience using static site generators such as Gatsby and Hydrogen;Fluent in JavaScript, CSS, HTML, and Webpack;Experience working with React.js;Experience working with Node.js;Experience working with AWS;Experience working with GraphQLExperience with Google Marketing Platform;Understanding of basic marketing principles;Ability to prioritise and execute tasks in a dynamic (and fun) environment;Strong multi-tasking and organisational skills, with excellent attention to detail;Enjoys working in a team and collaborating with others.Are you a Dabbler?A Dabbler’s attitude is paramount, as the right person will be able to learn quickly and adapt to any skill gaps. A Dabbler is always a team player, with a willingness to share with and learn from others. Being a remote-first workplace, collaborative working styles are crucial to empower and grow each individual member (eg we prefer openness via public channels to problem solve or ideate on Slack).A Dabbler uses their freedom of autonomy to its absolute potential and enjoys contributing to the Dabble community. We hold respect for our peers very highly – there is no such thing as a bad idea. We encourage you to think differently, be brave and strive to always raise the bar. Dabble was born out of thought sharing and should tackle growth in the same way. Dabble embraces empowerment of all people at any level of seniority and experience to ‘own their work’ and ‘talk their book’ wherever they can.RemunerationThe advertised salary for this position is $100, 000 - $120, 000 + Super + Benefits with room to be flexible.

title: Back-end Developer
description:
At Neota, we are pioneers in no-code automation. Our technology empowers customers to fundamentally transform how they work and how they deliver services, with the result being business automation solutions delivering outcomes of much better quality, far greater consistency, and of astronomical scale compared to traditional or otherwise manual ways of working.We believe that our greatest asset is the people behind our platform. That technology is most powerful when driven by purpose. Our no-code platform is a game-changer for legal, procurement, risk and compliance professionals and we are always looking for curious minds and results-oriented professionals to join us.What you will be doing: Making daily contributions to the server components of Neota Logic’s SaaS platform, using Scala, Play, SQL, and a variety of server-side tools. Working with the front end team to design and implement flexible, secure, high-performance, highly-available RESTful/GraphQL API’s. Working with the product team to ensure that your software is delivered on time and as expected. Focusing on quality, by writing unit tests and collaborating with QA to develop robust test plans.What we are looking for: 3+ years of hands-on object oriented design and development using proven architectural patterns (in any major language; Java, Scala preferred). Proficiency in relational database design, architecture, scalability, performance, and tuning. Experience designing and building scalable & secure RESTful/GraphQL API’s. Experience with cloud infrastructure & services (AWS, Azure). Experience writing unit tests and collaborating with QA engineers to develop test plans. Experience with front-end web technologies such as JavaScript/JQuery, HTML5, CSS (a plus). The ability to come up to speed quickly and thrive in an environment rich in complexity. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present ideas and solutions in a clear and organized manner. The ability to work independently and achieve established goals with minimal supervision.Strong attention to detail, but with a solid grasp of the bigger picture.RequirementsRequired Skills: Object Oriented programming (Java or Scala preferred), API design, Performance analysis, RDBMS/SQLSupporting Skills: GraphQL, Git, Security, AWS/AzureEducation: BSCS (MSCS/PhD a strong plus)Professional Experience: 5+ years (3+ years with MSCS)BenefitsWe value our employees’ time and efforts. We work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, with flexible working conditions and an encouraging environment where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionGumtree, together with Carsguide and Autotrader, have joined The Market Herald (ASX:TMH) to create Australia’s leading multi-category classifieds marketplace, business and finance community forum, and editorial lifestyle network reaching more than 1 in 3 Australian adults every month.Job DescriptionWorking as part of a cross functional agile team you will be creating new features that engage and delight our customers. You seek out new opportunities and don’t shy away from challenges.You bring energy and enthusiasm to the office every single day.You put the customer at the forefront of every decision you make.You love a challenge and look for creative ways to solve problems fast.Additional InformationWhat we offer:Meaningful work with diverse, highly skilled and passionate teams which give you the chance to make a difference in our customers’ lives.Competitive compensation package including annual bonus.An additional day off for your birthday!A healthy work-life balance, i.e. additional paid parental leave time, flexible working hours including a hybrid working environment.Excellent Benefits which include health insurance for you and your family!

title: Backend Software Engineer
description:
Bright is building an aggregated food ordering app with health tracking. It’s like Google search for venues/menus with Apple health integrated throughout. We’ve raised ~$2mil so far and are planning to start a ~$10m seed round in mid-2023.Users can order from pre-existing food/delivery platforms like UberEats, Menulog, DoorDash, Dan Murphy’s, Coles, and Woolworths at no extra cost. We use machine learning to generate nutrition profiles for all menu items, and these insights are passed onto our health-tracking system which is deeply integrated throughout the app. Our health tracking features are like an operating system for health and wellness because users can manage their micros/macros, track vitamin and nutrients, set dietary and allergen filters, alongside calculate their energy expenditure.RoleWe are seeking a Software Engineer to join our team and support the development/maintenance of our order-forwarding systems. Our codebase is mostly in Python3 and is hosted on Google Cloud Platform across GAE, Cloud Functions, and Compute Engine. We also use MongoDB and Google Firebase.Essential ResponsibilitiesDeveloping Flask APIs that interface with public-facing APIs of major food delivery platforms like UberEats, Menulog, and DoorDash.Using Selenium to create ordering scripts via Chrome Webdriver.Reporting defects and working with the team to resolve themDebugging existing APIs through automated test scripts.Deploying applications and working with instance scaling to Google Cloud Platform.Collaborate to clarify requirements, especially in terms of testability, consistency, and completeness.Qualifications:Background in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related degree.2+ years of experience in a similar field.Fluency in Python3 is a must.Awareness and/or experience with GCP and/or AWS and its various tools, such as GAE, Cloud Functions, Compute Engine, and VPC Network.Experience with Flask, Django, or FastAPI Frameworks.Experience with Bitbucket/GitHub/Gitlab versioning control tools.Experience writing documentation using Swagger in OpenAPI 2/3 standard.Would be nice to have:Experience with MongoDB and Google Firestore NoSQL frameworks.Experience with Node.js and Typescript.Experience in web scraping using Selenium or similar libraries.Familiarity with API testing tools like Postman

title: Backend Developer (Node.JS)
description:
Easygo is a well-established tech scale-up and we pride ourselves on being early adopters, progressive in our approach and remain agile in the ever-changing technology landscape.Our core focus is in the online gaming space — building well-designed casino games, crypto platforms and sportsbooks. The products we build are used by millions around the world and you'll see their logos across the EPL, UFC, F1 advocated by e-gamers and in a number of other sporting spaces.The last three years have been huge for us, growing from 20 to 150+ team members. Whilst the products that we have built are global, the majority of the team sits in our Australian headquarters which is in the heart of Melbourne's CBD. We value company culture and team collaboration, and currently have a hybrid working model in place, with three days in the office and two days working from home. However, majority of teams do enjoy coming in almost every day, and could we blame them? We've got all the bells and whistles you could want, including an in-house barista, table tennis and pool tables, PS5 and Nintendo Switches, a meditation room, free weekly massages, catered breakfast daily, free Friday weekly company pub lunches alongside with a Friday cocktail hour and all you can help yourself to drinks fridge and snack wall. The Role:We are constantly on the lookout for Backend developers to join our team and you'll be responsible for the server-side of our web applications. Ultimately, we would like you to be able to develop, maintain and create functional web applications to a high level of standard. Thus, if you have excellent programming skills and a passion for developing applications or improving existing ones, we would like to meet you! We also do offer a competitive salary depending on experience, with a broad range starting from $90,000 - $160,000 + Super. Main duties and responsibilities:   Development of our exciting innovative games and features Developing Microservices Produce readable and reusable code Doing API integrations  Increase efficiency through automation, workflow streamlining, and system optimization Promote high code standards within the team Optimisation of the game for best performance Code and debug core platform components Work at all stages of the product lifecycle from requirements capture, through design and implementation to testing and integration Keeping up with current and emerging technologies, and making recommendations to the team Dedicate care and responsibility for the final quality of the product Promote high code standards within the team Requirements Proven work experience as a Back-end developer with over 2+ years of experience  In-depth understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment) Comprehensive understanding of our development stack, languages and frameworks, specifically: NodeJS (TypeScript), GraphQL, API Integrations, Relational Databases, Kubernetes & Docker. Excellent analytical and time management skills Teamwork skills with a problem-solving attitude It would be a bonus if you also had (Desirable skills): Postgres or ElasticSearch expertise Big Data / analytics experience (i.e AWS Redshift, ETL tools, Tableau, MicroStrategy) Benefits Flexible working hours Team socials and adhoc get-togethers, and events for you to get involved in (if you wish) $750 per annum to spend on upskilling/training Optional flu shot (for the entire office) and paid time off to get your Covid vaccine Daily catered breakfast Massage Wednesdays - we get professionals to do this! Friday parmas/pub lunch, plus happy hour in the office from 4PM Table tennis and pool tables, plus a games room with PS5 and dartboards Company retreats each year One (1) paid volunteer day per year A full-time barista/kitchen manager who will make you coffee, tea and fresh juices Help yourself to the fully stocked drinks fridge and snack shelf Our amazing Workplace Experience Manager Renae will get you the snacks you desire! We have many many more initiatives that we will roll out over the next 12 months."We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant"We believe that the unique contributions of everyone at Easygo are the driver of our success.To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.We are passionate about providing a workplace that encourages great participation and an equal playing field, where merit and accomplishment are the only criteria for success.

title: Back End Developer
description:
Team: Product and DevelopmentWho we are:Picklebet is a next generation esports, sports and racing betting platform and media brand. Australian owned & operated, we are set to become a major player, both in Australia and internationally.The Picklebet team is dedicated to building remarkable products for the betting community; designed to entertain and deliver fun, engaging experiences.After significant growth in 2022, we are looking to expand our development capabilities, for our in house technology stack. Joining as part of a growing team, we need smart, and self-motivated people to come along for the ride, to take us to the next level, and deliver on our mission.Purpose of this role: We are looking for a senior back end developer to work on our live, multi-platform, multi-user entertainment platform. You’ll work closely with our CTO, developers and other stakeholders in a highly collaborative and technical environment.Below are some of the traits and experience that will make you successful in this role:API Development Experience - The primary focus of this role is developing the HTTP APIs and business logic to power the Picklebet platform. We need someone with experience in this area. They will have a history of delivering several projects under their belt. Picklebet is built using Kotlin, experience with other JVM languages is valuable but Kotlin will be the language you use day to day. Proven ability to get things done - We are a small team that build and operate a complex and rapidly scaling betting platform. We are proud of the amount and quality of work we get out the door each week and are looking for someone with a similar attitude and ability. If you want to work somewhere where the code you write today is being used by tens of thousands of customers next week then Picklebet might be for you. This means you're willing to get stuck in and get things done even if it is something outside your day to day role.End to end view of software development - You will be working closely with colleagues to deliver features from inception, design, implementation, QA to deployment and operation. Once live you will be monitoring, iterating and improving your solutions based on customer feedback. Self managed - We are not big on micromanagement at Picklebet, instead giving you the freedom to operate however you choose to perform at your best; this will require a level of ability to manage your own day to day tasks and communicate effectively.Scalable and Performant Solutions - Picklebet is in an exciting transition phase, as our user base grows we are encountering those 'Nice to have' scaling problems start ups have. Experience and interest in solving those kinds of problems is a valuable asset in this role.Databases - We lean heavily on our PostgreSQL database so strong SQL, database design and RDBMS knowledge is a must.Remote working - Ability to work remotely. We work remotely by default but there is an opportunity to work in the Newstead office if that suits you. We try to get into the office once a week because some things are just better face to face.Cloud experience - Experience building applications that run in a cloud environment is essential. Experience configuring and maintaining cloud environments is also valuable.Ability to work in a team - You need to be able to communicate and collaborate effectively in a team environment. As a team we are continually trying to improve, so we are looking for people that want to contribute to that process with new ideas, technologies and approaches that drive our team and product forward.Gambling Industry - Must be willing to work in the gambling industry, we understand that isn't for everyone. Knowledge and background in gambling would be a plus.Front End Web Development - Experience in this area is a bonus. There are opportunities to work on the UI side of the platform but primarily this is a back end role.Education - A Bachelor's Degree or equivalent commercial experience.Qualifications3+ years experience in a similar role.  If you don’t have 3+ years experience but can point to relevant work that impresses this will be acceptable. University qualifications would be desirable but not essential.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
location: North Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
description:
Company DescriptionWho we are:FinClear was established in 2015, with offices now in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth. We are an independent, Australian owned and developed technology and financial services business, specializing in providing trading, execution, clearing and technology solutions to wholesale intermediaries, FinTech’s, wealth managers and financial planners.At FinClear - Technology and progress are in our DNA. Our Financial Markets infrastructure deals with massive amounts of data and huge volumes of transactions that are executed in real-time to a vast audience. But unlike others, we own our core regulatory and technology infrastructure enabling us to move quickly and build solutions to give our clients the competitive advantage.We’ve tripled in size since mid-2021 and plan to continue growing with more platforms and services being rapidly developed. That’s where you come in.Job DescriptionAbout the role:FinClear is looking for a Software Engineer to join us on our journey as we continue to build functionalities across our FCX platform that leverages the power of Distributed Ledger Technology. This role will be working within a team of 4 in Sydney that collaborates with other squads across Perth & Melbourne. These squads form part of a larger cross functional technology team of 60 and growing.At FinClear, the team of Software Engineers come from diverse backgrounds and have a passion for their craft. With feedback from both internal and external users, our Software Engineers are equipped to make better decisions on how to enhance, build and optimize a suite of products that delights our customers. You will work alongside industry experts and talented senior engineers, building a new financial platform with modern technology and tools, where your contributions will have a strong impact on the success of the platform.Based on the current composition of the squad, we believe a passionate Software Engineer who enjoys working with a team of seniors across the Full Stack would really enjoy the opportunity.Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:Contributing to product features that reach beyond the UI, into our ecosystem of Microservices. Producing code that is well written, maintainable, security conscious and performant. Developing stunning, professional User Interfaces with React, Next.JS and MUI. Maintaining the platform and resolving issues as they arise. Collaborating with other specialists in the team as you work together on Epics and Sprints. Working with other squads on business objectives as opportunities ariseCode reviewsMentor and share your knowledge with other Software EngineersParticipate in learning and development sessionsThe Tech Stack:React, Next.JS, MUI, JavaScript, TypescriptDAML Smart Contracts & Ledger TechnologyMicroservice Architecture, Consul, VaultGRPC MessagingJava EE, JPA, GuicePostgreSQLGit, Maven, Jira, Confluence QualificationsRequired:Minimum of 3+ years working experience in React3+ years experience working within a Java environmentBonus points for:Proven experience working with Next.JSAdditional InformationWhat are the ingredients to our secret sauce?That’s our people and the technology solutions we create, as the business grows, we are also evolving our benefits to one that our people love!Benefits:A team that is invested in the success of FinClear and a generous ESOP for all our employees16 Weeks of gender neutral paid parental leaveA flexible work environment - we have fantastic new offices where we come to collaborate and have those face-to-face meetings with some days at home An inclusive and diverse working environment for allPrioritise mental health with all our staff having free access to our EAP programme including 1:1 session with qualified coaches and psychologistsE-Vehicles – Salary SacrificeReady to apply?If this sounds like something you might be interested in, submit your application by selecting “I'm Interested” or "Apply".Alternatively :To refer a friend, select "Refer a friend"For More information about FinClear, visit our Careers page https://finclear.com.au/careersAny additional queries Email : careers@finclear.com.au Please note :Applications will be reviewed w/c 13/03/2023Rights to legally work in Australia is a must to be considered for the immediate opportunities at FinClear, (sponsorship options are currently not an option)

title: Software Engineer, Full Stack (Australia)
description:
Equal Access to High-Quality Education Moves Our World ForwardMeet Cadmus!At Cadmus, we believe every student should have equal opportunity to achieve academic excellence; that’s why we’re changing how the world learns!Cadmus is a global EdTech company purposefully built for the higher education sector to break down global learning barriers by providing educators and diverse student cohorts with access to high-quality learning and assessment. Built on rich, student-centric values, Cadmus empowers individuals to achieve their highest potential and graduate with the critical skills and knowledge to profoundly impact our workforces, communities, and evolving world.A Bold Plan for Global ImpactAt Cadmus, we’re working hard in pursuit of an ambitious, world-shaping goal: to provide 1 billion students with access to high-quality education by 2050.That’s why we need a Full Stack Development superstar to join our team and help us maintain a high-quality experience for our users worldwide — ensuring our cloud infrastructure is reliable, performant and set up to scale. We want to do everything we can to ensure our users enjoy their experience and love our platform. With countless opportunities to make an impact, you’ll help us solve exciting engineering challenges and deliver improved functionality to take Cadmus even further.About The RoleAs a Full Stack Developer, you'll work across multiple codebases with a small team of cross-functional developers to solve a wide range of product engineering and architectural design challenges. You'll apply your software engineering skills to build performant, modern front-end applications with functional paradigms in React and Typescript. You'll also implement the backend GraphQL APIs (Elixir) and the micro-services which furnish the product features.You will have strong ownership across the development cycle and in addition to implementing new features, you'll focus on improving performance and reliability, and polish existing features. This is a truly unique opportunity to help shape our technology stack, processes, and contribute to the culture of the engineering team.About Our TechReact (Typescript) front-end web applications (SPA)Elixir backend with GraphQL APIsHaskell web services and Typescript (NodeJS) lambda functionsAWS cloud infrastructureWe also use and love to experiment with other languages for various tooling to ensure we find the best tool for the job. If you want to know more about what it’s like to be a developer at Cadmus, check out our blog post.RequirementsWe want to hear from developers with a passion for building modern web applications. You love exploring new technologies in order to solve problems and want to make constant improvements to our users’ experience. You have an eye for UI design and an interest in applying product development methodologies to boost the user experience. You thrive working in a team, love end-to-end ownership, obsess over details, and use data to help make the best choices for the wider business.In this role you'll:Develop complex front-end applications in React, in Typescript, and the GraphQL and REST APIs servicing themImplement features for our web-based rich-text Editor and the surrounding architecture for a complete online editing environmentWrite code and services for the backend systems in Elixir, Haskell, and other languages to implement business logicImplement the testing, performance, and telemetry processes for the product features to ensure a high-quality experience for our usersPlay an active role in designing and improving the overall product architecture to support massive growth in users and productsCollaborate with product designers and other developers to scope and plan new features, translating requirements for a feature into technical designWe’d love to hear from you if you have:2-4 years industry experience in software developmentExperience developing rich front-end applications in React and using the frameworks in the React ecosystemExperience with Typescript and Browser DOM APIsExperience in creating and working with front-end design systems, CSS-in-JS and CSS layouts with Flexbox and Grid systemsBack-end programming experience with languages like Elixir, Typescript (NodeJS), Ruby, Haskell, or similar in building web serversKnowledge of computer science fundamentals, data structures and design patterns, and an ability to use them practically when implementing solutionsWe'd really love to hear from you if you have:Startup DNA; you’re flexible, comfortable with ambiguity, and have experience scaling systems to support rapid growthExperience with Functional Programming languagesBenefitsA remote-friendly, flexible working culture; where you can work from any global locationLearning allowances; because we don’t just have words on a website, we genuinely do what we say and provide educational opportunities to all (including the Cadmus team)A diverse and inclusive workplace where there are no barriers to anyone succeedingA surrounding team of mission-driven individuals who genuinely love what they doEquity incentives; that way, we all share in the success of CadmusMentoring and succession planning for your careerVirtual pats from Homer, our resident (and super cute) dog!We're a remote-friendly company, and this role is open to candidates based in Melbourne or remote from anywhere in Australia.Hiring ProcessApply online with your resume only.Instead of a cover letter, we’d love for you to answer a few questions alongside your application.Our interview process is normally a recruiter interview, a hiring manager interview, a programming task, and 2-3 hours of onsite interviews that will be held via Zoom.While we review your application, get to know us by visiting cadmus.io or following our social channels.Inclusivity at CadmusAt Cadmus, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds because it makes our company stronger. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital, or disability status. If you share our values and enthusiasm for education, you will find a home at Cadmus.If you need assistance or accommodations made due to a disability, please let us know.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Why join MagicBrief?At MagicBrief our mission is to become the tool makers for a generation of businesses, enabling creative teams and entrepreneurs to scale their brands. We’re looking for a skilled Frontend Engineer to help us deliver product that businesses are relying on to grow.We’re backed by the best, including Blackbird, Archangel and a talented group of individuals, including the founders of Vimeo, UsTwo, Eucalyptus, Spriggy & Halter.About The RoleWe’re still early in the MagicBrief journey, but our customer base is growing rapidly, and our product roadmap is substantial. If you want to get in on the ground floor and make a significant impact on the development of the product, this is the role for you.You'll be an integral part of our engineering team, working directly with our founding team. You'll have a significant impact on our product and help shape our future.We're an engineering-led organisation and offer an excellent work environment with a modern tech stack that includes full CI/CD, a fully supported local development environment (frontend and back), in-depth code reviews and mentorship.We use a modern stack for design and development, including Notion, Linear and Figma.We also dedicate 10% of our Engineering time to internal itches, including improving pipeline performance, building developer tools, improving infrastructure and paying down technical debt before it becomes a drag on the organisation and contributing back to open source.We use TypeScript and build scalable systems so we can continuously make progress on a solid foundation. We don’t expect you to have a background in everything we use, but we do expect strong JavaScript fundamentals and a background working with React, and ideally TypeScript.What You’ll DoWork closely with founders and design to implement fast new feature conceptsBuilding new user-facing features with beautiful and scalable UI componentsImproving application performance by profilingDesign and develop the frontend of the company's software products using modern technologies such as ReactCollaborate with other engineers, designers, and stakeholders to build highly-performant, scalable, and responsive user interfacesImplement and maintain test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processesAct as a technical expert and mentor to other team membersParticipate in code reviews and ensure that the code is maintainable, scalable, and follows best practicesStay up-to-date with the latest web development technologies, trends and best practicesWork with the product team to identify and implement new features and improvements to the softwareTechTypescriptNodeExpressDockerPostgresRedisPrismatRPC (if you don’t know this, you’ll learn to love it quickly)ReactTailwind (& Tailwind UI)RequirementsStrong experience with JavaScript and web development best practices. A minimum of 3 years of experience in web development, with at least 2 years of experience building user interfaces using modern frontend frameworks such as React,Strong experience with HTML, CSS and modern web technologies such as Webpack, etc. Experience with implementing and maintaining test-driven development and continuous integration/delivery processes. Strong problem-solving skills, ability to think creatively, and ability to adapt to new technologiesStrong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well in a teamStrong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentWhat We OfferInteresting and challenging workA super supportive teamCompetitive salary and equityDirect involvement with the founders gives you a chance to have a real impact on the company's futureCentral city officeFantastic opportunities for personal and professional growthA chance to work on a product that helps people’s businesses grow and succeedAn engineering-led culture where you will be a core part of the teamWe believe that as an early-stage company, working together in person gives us a competitive edge by letting us move faster and make decisions together on the fly. We also appreciate the importance of deep work, and we are set on building a culture that facilitates it.If you’ve gotten this far in the job ad and think this is for you, come make some magic. We want someone who reads the whole brief and sweats the details for this role.

title: Fullstack Engineer - SRE
description:
Upflowy was founded on the core belief that growth plays a vital role in our everyday life, at every level, personal and company. Upflowy is here to help growth leaders build and AB test their lead and signup flows without the engineering burden. We’re solving for up to 60% of marketing resources being wasted on non-optimized first interactions with their users. Beyond that, we’re here to define a new category of best-in-class experiences throughout the whole online journey, leveraging fast iterations and advanced personalization.This is the perfect opportunity to join an innovative business that challenges the status quo and sets the benchmark for others to follow. You'll be part of an open, team-oriented, and results-based culture where your input is encouraged and your success is rewarded.You can see more details about our launch on Product Hunt here. We’re excited to say we were the No.1 product for that week.And you can read more about our Seed funding round on Tech Crunch here.DiversityAt Upflow we know that diverse teams are better performing teams. Statistics show that certain parts of the job seeking demographic won’t apply if they feel they aren’t a 100% match to the requirements, but we want to change that. So even if you think you don’t meet all of the skills listed, or tick all the boxes, please still apply as we’d love to hear from you.Fullstack Software Engineer / SREYour work will be instrumental in how we set up and run our Dev, Integration, Test, Staging and Production environments and processes. Within these cycles, you can help build a key pillar of Upflowy’s growing Engineering culture, and ensure our Engineers have the best environment possible to deliver a world class product to our customers.Our product is growing quickly, 1,000 accounts to 20,000+ in 2022 alone. Being at the front of this engineering challenge, you can add tremendous value to how we set up CI/CD pipelines, how our product scales, how we monitor our infrastructure and how our developers write, test and deploy code.You will find solutions and bring ideas and opinions to our Engineering discussions. The role straddles both Engineering and SRE disciplines and you’ll need to be comfortable and enjoy both.RequirementsWe’d love someone to bring as many of these as possible, but it’s rare to have all of them so please apply if you don’t have 100% of the skills listed.Development experience with JavaScript, Node.JS, React.JS, Typescript and associated librariesServerless Architecture SRE experience, with a focus on “The 4 Golden Signals of SRE”Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)Maintenance, monitoring and improvement of CI/CD pipelines (Gitlab & Kubernetes)Automation experience, ideally at scaleB2B SaaS product experienceExperience mentoring other Engineers and contributing to best practice discussionsTriage, diagnosis and root cause resolutionBenefitsAttractive salary & ESOPSalary Sacrifice for EquipmentRemote first working cultureChoice of equipment and hardware when startingTeam social eventsCareer path development program2 Team Offsites per year (pending Covid)Tailored Health & Wellness AllowanceEducation Allowance
