title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Company DescriptionAbout UsWe bring together science, engineering and technology to deliver smart solutions to our Government customers’ most complex problems – innovative, technically advanced and highly practical. For example, we deliver software applications for a wide range of missions in the Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance domain. We provide critical projects to the Department of Defence and also support the IT environment for the Australian Taxation Office. We also maintain legislative websites for a number of Governments.Job DescriptionYour New RoleYou will work with a team of DevOps Administrators to rapidly build and deploy enhancements to a DevSecOps Platform, while simultaneously supporting it. The development will take place in an iterative fashion using agile methodologies with inputs from multiple stakeholders.Primary Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited ToDevelops solutions to technical problems that require depth of technical knowledge, but are typically limited in complexityAddresses complex technical issues/problems using internal best practice and through collaboration with colleaguesExplains technical solutions, practices and procedures to others within the organisationWork with the Systems Engineering team designing, building, and supporting new Infrastructure technologies and services, with a focus towards automationImplement build and deploy workflow automation to support continuous integration and deploymentProvides support to DevSecOps Platform by following best practicesAssist in the development of routine reporting and development of ad-hoc reportsRun, maintain and upgrade different Product environments (Development, Test, Production)Provide security techniques and expertise to ensure the infrastructure and software services meet specific security standards.Please note the successful applicant must be an Australian citizen and hold a NV-1 or NV-2 level Australian Government Security Clearance.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringRequiredCoupled with your education and practical experience, you will demonstrate a pro-active approach with the ability to understand the business, identify issues and develop relationships to achieve the company’s objectives. You will also have:Demonstrated proficiency in Red Hat Linux and Windows Server Operating SystemsExperience deploying and maintaining a DevSecOps platformContainerised application deployment experienceStrong stakeholder management skillsSoftware development lifecycle knowledgeInfrastructure as Code experienceTroubleshooting and Coordinating skills to resolve identified issuesStrong team focus and willingness to learn new technologiesKnowledge in Incident and Change Management processDesirableDemonstrated proficiency in using Ansible for automationKubernetes cluster administration experienceExperience with source code and artefact managementExperience in administrating Elasticsearch clustersDemonstrated experience building Kibana visualizations and dashboardsAdditional InformationWhat You'll LoveAt Leidos we look after our staff. Flexible working practices, great team building initiatives, consistent learning and development opportunities, employee discounts and excellent exposure to a variety of technologies and projects are just some of the perks. We are growing and evolving, so it’s an exciting place to be.Our diverse employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. Leidos is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Company Description (About us)Fortiro is a growing fintech with a highly experienced team, backed by significant investment, and giving you the opportunity to create something great! Contribute to a platform that uses emerging technologies and AI to help prevent financial crime and enable automation – used by leading Banks and Government in Australia, New Zealand and (eventually) the globe!Our software product can be licensed as Software-as-a-Service and is at the forefront of next-generation document fraud detection and automation.About youYou are passionate about cloud and security, with cutting edge, hands-on technical skills and an unwavering commitment to quality.You also have2+ years experience in a DevOps Engineer role with a good record of hands-on accomplishments across the various areas of responsibilities outlined below.Experience working in a fully agile development environment, including good grasp of the common tools and ways of working including software release management via CI/CD pipelines and source repository management.A passion for DevOps processes and AWS Cloud services related to system administration, such as provisioning and managing servers, deploying databases, security monitoring, system patching, event logging and monitoring, and managing VPCs, security groups, firewall policies, etc.Qualifications or training in network and application security and/or a good understanding in best practice security frameworks (e.g. NIST, ISO27001, etc.)Understanding of reliability engineering, capacity planning, performance monitoring and load testing to ensure the availability of our SaaS solution and performance at scale. Hands-on experience working with Java and Python.In-depth understanding of microservice architecture, API management, distributed systems concepts and containerisation. Worked with tools such as Azure DevOps, AWS EC2, RDS, ECS, ELB, Route 53, S3, Step Functions, Lambdas, Cloudwatch and CloudFormation. Responsibilities – you will... Deliver sprint-based projects as part of a talented team of engineers using Agile and DevOps methodologies. Drive automation, standardisation and quality in delivery. Work closely with and incorporate feedback from product management, architects, system engineers, test engineers and customer success. Our expectation for a successful DevOps Engineer: Demonstrating passion and interest in our product and how our customers use it to solve their problems. Anticipating and resolving challenges by engaging with relevant team members to get input, and then making the necessary decisions to move forward with a sound resolution. Communicating with transparency, clarity, trust and honesty to manage and motivate junior developers, while managing expectations of the Head of Engineering, Product Manager and leadership team.  What we offer – and how we help you reach your best potential We encourage you to be you. We constantly seek and value different perspectives to ensure Fortiro is a place where everyone feels comfortable and can be successful. Our long-term employee retention rate agrees! We know that our people are the key to our success, so we empower everyone to make an impact. You will have the opportunity to make a real and meaningful impact to our top tier enterprise and government customers with the best fraud detection solution for financial documents in the world. You’ll be working in a young and growing business that is a spin-off from Australia’s largest professional services firm. So you’ll get to experience the best of both “corporate” and “start-up” worlds: professional ways of working with best-in-class tools and processes – just faster and more agile with flat decision-making hierarchies.  Our culture is a key cornerstone of our workplace - we’re open, inclusive, embrace differences and love to have fun. We offer flexible work options with both remote and in-person work environments.  Your salary will be competitive based on your experience, with defined career progression opportunities, learning & development, formal check-ins and annual plans to ensure you continue to grow and develop your skills and progress your career.

title: Product Manager at Fast Growing Start Up
description:
About UsBluethumb exist to connect art creators and collectors across the world. We're Australia's largest online art marketplace and one of Australia's most successful creative technology companies.We represent over 20,000 emerging and established artists from across Australia. With over 50,000 artworks sold, we have a fast-growing reputation for outstanding quality of service to homeowners across the country; from first-time buyers to collectors, as well as interior designers and architecture firms.Bluethumb envisions a world where creating and collecting art is open to all, we're now in our 10th year but that isn’t slowing us down! On average we’ve doubled in size every year for 10 years straight. Along the way we’ve helped more artists on their path to a sustainable career and sold more original artworks on the primary market than any other organisation in Australia’s history.The opportunityThis is an incredible opportunity for a product specialist to work in a high growth creative technology company. Our total team size has recently doubled to over 30 and we have an awesome pipeline of growth projects ahead. We want someone who can work alongside the Founders and CTO to build Bluethumb into the best online art platform in the world. We have succeeded so far by focusing on creating better technology for users. This won't change. Our next years are expanding our core market whilst launching expanding overseas. We will also enter the Secondary Art market and continue building out our NFT marketplace.RequirementsWhat You'll DoBe a staunch advocate for our users; our artists and art collectors. Speak up for the user at every point, dive deep on how they use Bluethumb, distill feature requests through a user-focussed lens. Alongside the CTO, help run the product team sprints. We currently have five full stack developers, a QA and a visual designer. We plan 3 week development sprints, with a code freeze week. Part of the role is roadmap planning ahead of each sprint to work out what we build next, and short retros afterwards. Manage and own the development board. This role is an intentional product team bottleneck. All new bugs, feature suggestions and epics are written into cards by the Product Owner. Ruthlessly prioritise what gets built and what doesn't. Wireframes are a bonus for briefing our designer, but not a must-have. Bring new product ideas to the team. Who We Are Looking ForA technology enthusiast. Someone who's curious about what's new. Minimum of 2 years experience in a product specialist/product owner-type role, building technology. A degree in Computer Science or similar. Someone with a growth mindset, motivated work ethic and accountability. An interest in design or art is a bonus. Our CultureWhy you might love working at Bluethumb: We always hire the best possible person we can for the job. This has meant great diversity and a talented group of people. We are mission driven. We exist to grow Australia’s art industry and help artists build a sustainable living. There’s high autonomy and licence to get the job done the best way possible. You appreciate receiving feedback, tough feedback more than praise.You want to get your hands dirty and would happily do a round of user testing with our customers and target market. You are happy to work from home or with team members. We’re a distributed startup and this means using many channels of communication. Why working at Bluethumb might not work for you:We’re startup / scale up and there is a lot going on. You’ll need to keep the core business on track, deal with unexpected growth problems whilst concurrently launching new projects. You need to speak up to be heard. People are in different positions and places and you’ll need to be confident and a strong communicator.You’ll need to process a lot of information and be driven to quickly learn this and help us expand. We put ourselves in situations where failing publicly is a possibility. We understand this is life at Bluethumb and work as hard as possible to succeed, and when there’s failure we learn from the experience and pick ourselves back up to charge on.BenefitsYou’ll receive a competitive salary with the potential to qualify for ESOP (employee share option plan).If you are Melbourne or Adelaide based, we have amazing gallery & office spaces which are Dog-friendly. We are a distributed company with a great balance between WFH and office life. You get 4 weeks paid vacation, flexibility to take extra unpaid leave, and flexible working hours. We’re all about getting the work done, not just clocking time.Staff discounts on Australia’s best art! Fun team activities, lunches and projects. We're excited and grateful for your interest and application. This role is life-changing because we do things that have a huge impact both personally and for Australia's art industry. Strap in and enjoy the ride!

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
We’re Slyp. And we’re on a mission to eliminate paper receipts for good. Founded by former PayPal executives in 2017 and now backed by the four major banks, Slyp is an award-winning retail-fintech transforming the world of receipts.In Australia alone, we are printing over 1 billion meters of non-recyclable paper receipts each year. But this is just the start of the problem – we believe receipts are also a missed opportunity to understand and engage shoppers’ post-purchase.Slyp automatically delivers a revolutionary smart receipt right inside your banking app to create a seamless customer experience. With Slyp, customers pay as normal and can immediately view and interact with their smart receipts in their mobile banking app, anytime.Our values (‘the Slyp six’) form the heart of everything we do and are apart of why Slyp is an award-winning Fintech backed by all four major banks.This is your chance to join as we shape the future of customer experience.PositionAs a Senior Product Manager, you will be responsible for shaping, driving and executing on the product, working across consumer, merchant and bank experiences. You will interact with our customers to understand their needs, and partner with our internal stakeholders to articulate or identify opportunities for growth.Your ability to balance strategic thinking, stakeholder requirements and execution will be critical to success. You will be working in an agile environment with cross functional teams including sales, marketing, data, design and an exceptional engineering team to build large product initiatives from concept to delivery.We are looking for a passionate person with experience in taking complex and differentiated solutions to market in user centric products.What You Will Be Doing …Develop and deliver on product roadmaps that align with Slyp’s vision, product strategy and commercial targetsUnderstand customer needs through research, market analysis, data, and customer feedbackTranslate requirements into product specificationsPrioritise and coordinate delivery schedules and ensure consensusScope and manage planned, existing or ongoing major and minor product releasesCoordinate with internal teams to produce marketing materials that speak to Slyp’s unique product experiencesProvide support to the Sales/Business Development teams to respond to product-related feedback and improvement requestsBe responsible for engaging and delivering with our high performing Engineering teamRequirementsYour experience and knowledge …A minimum of 5+ years’ experience in product leadership, including experience in either B2BC or B2B SaaS Experience leading a diverse team in the Fintech space, including Designers and EngineersStrong communication skills and public speaker, with an ability to negotiate and engage diverse internal and external stakeholdersProven ability to manage changing priorities and working in a fast-paced growth environmentDemonstrated ability working with agile methodologies, requirements gathering, prioritisation, identifying and addressing constraints, dependencies and risksAn ability to balance customer satisfaction as well as commercial outcomeYou use analytics and data-driven measurement to inform decision makingYou are customer driven and have a passion for speaking directly to customersHighly desirable that you have experience in delivering data and insights-based productsProven experience working with new products or new categories and have had exposure to loyalty, payments, data, e-commerce or a unique combination of theseBenefitsCompetitive salary + equityWellbeing perksGenerous L&D programFlexible work life balance: work from our Sydney office, from home, or from anywhere (for a time)Regular team lunches and give back days (Slyp Gives)Sweet (pet friendly) officeAlways-on team fun

title: Product Manager
location: Surry Hills, New South Wales, Australia
description:

In this role you will be leading the development of our core customer products, including our ecommerce and mobile app platforms, as well as evaluating expansion opportunities across our interactions with our customers and vendor partners.You will be responsible for managing the entire product lifecycle, from ideation to launch, and will work closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, CX, marketing and operations, to ensure successful product delivery.ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and execute product strategy and roadmap in collaboration with cross-functional teams. Engage regularly with internal stakeholders, and conduct external research / analyse customer feedback to prioritise product opportunities.Translate captured requirements and feature requests into user stories.Work with design and engineering teams (both internal & external) to develop and launch new products and features.Define and track product metrics and KPIs, and use data to make informed decisions.Work with our marketing and operations teams to ensure successful product launches and ongoing product support.Use appropriate tools to manage the product discovery process through to execution.QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCEExperience in similar roles within a B2C e-Commerce environment.Experience with loyalty retention and multi-channel offerings desirable.Experience in creating digital experience and product strategies.Previous experience with e-Commerce development lifecycle.Comprehensive experience with collaboration and management tools such as Jira and Confluence.An entrepreneurial mindset is critical to succeed in this role. With Australia’s largest range of wines, we showcase smaller independent producers and their stories by embracing leading digital technologies to create design solutions delivering new engaging content for our customers.

title: Product Manager (startups)
description:
Are you passionate about startups and entrepreneurship?We are seeking a passionate and results driven Product Manager to join the team in our Melbourne office.The ideal candidate is someone who’s worked the startup ecosystem before and loves working with others to creatively solve problems. You have an eye for design, love the freedom to work autonomously and the courage to push for the best outcome possible. Change is a natural part of your process and don’t mind taking risks to push the bar higher. You have a passion for technologyThe RoleYou’ll be working with 15 - 20 founders by taking them through our 3 month startup incubation program to help them get their idea off the ground. You’ll be actively involved in understanding the founder’s problem and working with the team on the best way to solve it. You’ll then manage the creation of the assets needed to validate the business and put them in the best position to raise the money needed to execute it correctly.You’ll be in control of the entire process and will get the chance to work on incredible ideas, quality founders and learn from our award winning team.You will have six main focuses:-Onboard new founders and provide an incredible experience with our brand.-Workshop the founder’s strategy with our team and pitch any pivots.-Manage the MVP product lifecycle of deliverables from concept, to designs and prototype-Develop the core positioning and messaging for the product.-Own the product strategy of each founders product idea-Work with our other product managers to continually improve our process.Skills, Knowledge and Experience-Familiarity with the Australian startup landscape.-Background with product discovery methodologies-Can easily build rapport and trust with a wide range of personalities.-Expert communicator, both visually, verbally and written.-Strong problem solving, analytical skills, and strategic thinking whilst continuing to see the big picture.-Experience in using data to make decisions.-Understands great design and knows how to motivate a team to produce quality work.-Experience working with designers, strategists, developers and business development.-A perfectionist for all of the things that matter (design, layout, formatting, spelling)-Knows how to take ownership of your projects to produce excellent results.-Can organise people, meetings and documents for a large number of projects.-Work with others on a shared resource pool to manage multiple priorities.-Motivated about learning, excited about the industry and quick to pick up new skills.-Demonstrated ability to be flexible and adaptable in the face of changing organisational priorities and ambiguous environments whilst continuing a strong focus on quality of work.BenefitsAnd let’s not forget the important part, what’s in it for you:-Connect with new tech founders, ideas and technologies before they become the next big thing-Opportunity to upskill and continuously learn in the role-Have a direct impact on the execution and direction of new startups-Build an incredible network within the Australian Startup ecosystem-Regular team outings and (hopefully) trips abroad-A competitive base rate, with a performance bonus-Clear career progression opportunity in the Product Management Team-A fun working environment!About HyperHyper is a global startup studio that provides you with the safest way to launch your startup. We believe that every idea should have the best possible chance of success. Guiding founders to validate, build and grow their technology businesses from ideation to investment. We’re your unfair advantage.900+ Founders & $300 Million raised to date.

title: Product Owner/Associate Product Manager
description:
About BountyMediaBountyMedia is a leading B2B2C AdTech SaaS platform. It is a unique GDPR compliant and globally scaled consent based customer acquisition model. We are a unique Zero Party Data platform working with leading Publishers and Advertisers globally in every media (Film, TV, News and Games) on a new platform. Venture funded. Headquartered in Singapore, operating remotely globally. Team are based in Bangkok, Singapore and Australia.Building a winning SaaS product team.The successful applicant for this role will be a key member of our product and technology team. As a start-up that is growing fast into global markets with leading corporate partners, the product development team at BountyMedia will be the driver for the success of our flagship product in the AdTech & Data space.Reporting to the Head of Product, this role will work alongside peer full-stack and front-end developers (in-house and external) as well as our DevOps, Infrastructure and UI/UX teams.The RoleThis is a full--time role that will be involved in several exciting projects and feature ownership and developments. As we’re a startup, our features and the nature of each project are widely varied - there’s nothing “normal” about any given week at BountyMedia! However, here are some of the things you would be working on regularly:Hands-on backlog and sprint management, making sure the backlog is well maintained and groomed based on broader product strategies and in collaboration with internal and external engineering teams.Being a story-teller, with high attention to details and can reflect those into well-defined, testable and deliverable user stories, epics and features.Being involved in Product Design /workflow design ensuring that our products remain cohesive, usable, and align with our overarching business and product strategy;Providing support and guidance to your peers - exemplifying best practice, processes and teamwork.Working alongside the Product leadership team and the management team exploring opportunities to improve on the product.Your main responsibilitiesPlanningParticipate in product planning, working with Head of Product to identify new opportunities to improve the product and commenting on feasibilityGuide the delivery of a product roadmap.Contribute to the development of Initiative summaries.Maintaining a prioritized backlog.Product DesignParticipate in product design activities such as discovery workshops and collaborative design sessions to identify new features or opportunities to improve the product and deliver customer valueActively participate in initiative processes such as initiative kick-off and epic kick-off sessions.Support the engineering and design teams in the translation of market and user requirements into exciting customer experiences.Document product requirements and design outcomes.Product DeliveryAct as the voice of the customer in the product delivery process.Participating in product delivery rituals such as initiative planning; sprint planning, showcases and retrospectives.Collaborating with team members on defining the narrative/context for deliverablesReview proposed requirements, and ensure that delivery is matches acceptance criteriaAssist in the prompt resolution of delivery risks.Escalating issues and impacts to the delivery to the management team.Determining whether the feature is complete based on the team’s definition of ‘Done’.Product LaunchEnsure all product documentation is current and accurate.Work with marketing to co-ordinate the internal launch of new features including running webinars and product showcases.What you’ll need for success.A minimum of 2 years’ proven product management or product ownership experience. Ideally in a SaaS and technology environment.A passion for delivering exceptional value to the partners and customers.Experience working in a similar role, where you have to take the ownership of multiple product streams.Experience in a product company or start-up, with extra credit for exposure to the AdTech or Data sector.Experience in working on browser-based web applications, working closely with UX/UI designers and engineering teams.Understanding of product management concepts and the product lifecycle from concept to launch in a commercial and sales-led environment.Good understanding of the role of the product owner in an agile development environment.Proven ability to learn new business concepts and translate this knowledge into new products and features.Degree in business; computing; design or marketing is looked on favorably, but not essential.The way we work and collaborateWe are a remote workplace, so you will be working from your home during your normal working hours. With teams spread across Australia, Thailand and Singapore, you will be working with different time zones and might be required to adjust your time occasionally so we can collaborate in a more effective and productive way.We are building a team of solid product and technology experts who can take the ownership of the project and task they do and defend it with having the user and customer in mind. You will have the opportunity to bring new ideas to the team, the way we work and to the product as well as helping the broader BountyMedia team to grow our existing products and platforms.Diversity means success.We welcome everybody to contribute to our success, regardless of identity, background, position, ability or lifestyle.A note on eligibility to applyIn order to apply for this position, you must have a valid working right in the country of the position. Unfortunately we will not be able to provide you with sponsorship or job application at this stage.

title: Product Manager
description:
PSG® is a global pump and dispensing solution expert and leading manufacturer of pumps, systems and related flow-control technology for the safe and efficient transfer of critical and valuable fluids and materials. Headquartered in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, USA, PSG is comprised of several world-class brands, including Abaque™, All-Flo, Almatec®, Blackmer®, Ebsray®, em-tec™, EnviroGear®, Griswold®, Hydro™, Malema™, Mouvex®, Neptune™, Quattroflow™ and Wilden®. PSG products are manufactured on three continents, North America, Europe, and Asia, in state-of-the-art facilities that practice lean manufacturing and are ISO-certified. PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of Dover Corporation. For additional information on PSG, please visit psgdover.com.We thrive on winning and being number one; and are always looking to add the best and brightest to our talented team of professionals. PSG offers a unique combination of the both small company atmosphere: with an ownership mindset that allows you to make close-to-the-customer decisions; an innovative approach in seeing beyond what is possible today and entrepreneurial spirit in the pursuit of new opportunities; combined with benefits of a large company’s scale, tools, expertise, and financial strength with Dover. Join PSG, a growing global company where your curiosity, hard work and ambition is rewarded with exceptional career opportunities in a friendly & fast paced environment.PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer and solutions provider with annual revenue of approximately $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, consumable supplies, aftermarket parts, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of over 23,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible.Position Summary:The purpose of this role is to achieve sustained growth and profitability in the country for the following brands of our pumps and compressors’ portfolio: Abaque™, Blackmer®, Mouvex® and Wilden®. The Product Manager will report to the Business Development Director and will work closely with the Sales Managers acting as a proactive member of the sales force. The success in this role requires a comprehensive understanding of the market and customer needs, combined with a strong knowledge of the features, functions and benefits of the assigned product lines.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Product strategy Act as an ambassador and a proactive member of the sales team by identifying new business opportunities in your assigned region (Australia and New Zealand). Gather and analyze the market, customer, and competitor intelligence to identify and quantify opportunities for growth in new geographical areas or new industries. Conduct market research through trade associations, internet investigation and corporate services Identify, understand and communicate market trends and requirements Gather the voice of customers & insights of key stakeholders Investigate market needs for innovative products and communicate them to Product Management as opportunities for product development Develop and maintain comprehensive knowledge of competitive products and their activity in the marketplace and provide reports, on a regular basisCommercial and Technical Support Providing guidance to the sales team and channel partners for selection, configuration, and quotation of products Provide support in marketing activities such as: creation of market literature, preparing for and supporting trade shows, industry events and PSG product training and customer events Providing technical support and troubleshooting for channel partners and end users Reviews engineering specifications and generates proposals Management of specific channel partners as may be required Proficient in company processes and policies pertaining to roleProduct knowledge Knowledge of the assigned products in detail including the operating principles and performance characteristics Conduct training of internal team members, channel partners, and other industry participants, such as EPCs, consultants, and end users Lead technical training about product selection, performance, and troubleshooting Other duties as assigned.Qualifications / Requirements:University degree (or equivalent) in a technical field (mechanical or chemical engineering or related) You have at least 5 years of professional experience in the product management, sales or account management of technical products Previous experience in related industry (pumps, valves, system design, rotating equipment, gearboxes, etc.). Ability to analyze a mechanical system and provide technical guidance for operation and troubleshooting.Proficient with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.Desired Characteristics:Highly organized and efficient in approaching tasks.Ability to professionally interact with customers on technical topics.Ability to select a pump and/or accessories based on application requirements.A self-starter with the ability to problem solve and anticipate and avoid issues.Clear, concise, and articulate communication skills - verbal, written and listening.Strong team player, work ethic and commitment to win.Work Arrangement : HybridSalary Range : -We consider several job-related, non-discriminatory factors when determining the pay rate for a position, including, but not limited to, the position’s responsibilities, a candidate’s work experience, a candidate’s education/training, the position’s location, and the key skills needed for the position. Pay is one of the Total Rewards that we provide to compensate and recognize employees for their work.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.This position may be located in: APAC : Australia : New South Wales : SydneySub Division : EbsrayJob Requisition ID : 48455

title: Product Manager
location: Taren Point, New South Wales, Australia
description:
For over 100 years, Shimano has concentrated on precision engineering, innovative merchandise and been a proven market leader in the supply of cycling and fishing products worldwide. As a business we are always looking to improve, create, innovate and resonate not only with our customers but with our internal teams. We are currently recruiting for an experienced Product Manager to join our Shimano Australia Fishing division on a permanent full-time basis. The primary duties will include but are not limited to;·        Maintain relationships and processes with manufacturers and Shimano Incorporated (SIC) to ensure compliance with Shimano vendor systems. ·        Manage all aspects of Product life cycle from market research to product inception to fulfill market needs and overall business objectives.·        Maintain product spec sheets. ·        Manage the sample process and report to SIC Planning and factories. ·        Design and develop new ranges with market trends and needs in mind to meet the market. ·        Monitor and report on stock levels and inventory to ensure company targets and metrics are met. ·        Report and suggest exit strategy for end-of-life products. ·        Manage pricing of products to ensure they meet the market·        Research and Identify trends in the market and propose proactive product strategies. ·        Work to increase market share in all categories Ideally candidates will need to possess:·        5 years’ experience in a similar role ·        Be highly proficient in the use of Excel, PowerPoint and Word ·        High levels of commercial and numeracy skills ·        Analytically minded ·        Excellent communication and presentation skills. ·        Pronto ERP·        Strong fishing / industry knowledge (preferred) This position is an office-based role situated in our Head Office in Caringbah. The successful candidate will need the preparedness to travel domestically and internationally, on average 6 trips per year. This position would suit an individual who is familiar with the fishing and outdoor industry, but the role is not limited to industry experience. Applications are to include a covering letter outlining your suitability to this role, noting your salary expectations, and attaching your updated resume.   Only applicants with full Australian working rights will be considered. An offer of employment is conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID19. Proof of vaccination status is required at the time of accepting the employment offer.   In return Shimano Australia Fishing will provide ongoing training, onsite free parking, social activities, access to EAP programs, and regular community events. Interviews may commence prior to the closing date, Thursday 30th March 2023. The vacancy will remain open until the successful candidate is appointed. To apply, go to https://shimanoaustralia.bamboohr.com/careers

title: Technical BA / Product Manager
description:
Join Simple Machines and be part of our mission to help clients unlock the full potential of their data through the creation of cutting-edge business driven data platforms and software solutions. As we continue to expand our team across Australia and New Zealand, we are seeking Technical BA / Product Manager who are unafraid to challenge the status quo and push boundaries.About YouWe are looking for a consultant-minded individual who is passionate about working closely with clients to solve complex problems and lead them on a journey from discovery to technical implementation. You have a knack for understanding client needs and delivering market-leading solutions.Have a background in Business Analysis | Technology Consulting | Software DevelopmentYou will love and excel in this role if you:Have a refined understanding of how modern software is built and delivered (tools, methodologies, roles, common challenges etc.)A demonstrated knowledge of different methods and tools that help you to perform analysis, testing, product management and delivery in a range of environmentKnow how to effectively communicate information between people at all levels of the business, in written and verbal formHave a passion for accruing knowledge, and using that knowledge to continuously improve yourself and the team’s performancePersonal interest in best practice and trends of the technology industry, with the ability to apply these to your day-to-day workA relationship builder by nature, and someone who can thrive in new teams and new situationsA proactive person who knows what needs to be done, how to approach it, and how to influence others to move things forwardAn ambitious person who is excited about the prospect of joining a small, close-knit ANZ team of experts and helping it to growThe Exciting PartSimple Machines is not your average consultancy or software engineering firm. Our team is comprised of inspiring technical leaders in Data Engineering, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence. Our projects are data-focused and drive impactful business outcomes.RequirementsAbout the RoleWe are looking for someone to join our close-knit team of experts in the UK to help deliver our client engagements as we scale our ANZ business.If you excel in client facing roles, have a deep understanding of how modern software is built and delivered, and have a passion for technology then we’d love to hear from you.Here’s a brief overview of the role’s responsibilities:Feed the engineering teamProvide high quality written requirements, acceptance criteria, feature overviews, test cases and other artefacts for the team to work fromRun effective meetings with team and stakeholdersDrive the team’s directionUnderstand and clearly articulate the business needsPersuade the client and the SM team on what should be done and whyIncrease the team’s speedUnderstand and anticipate dependencies in software deliveryEnable decision making through excellent communicationAssure the team’s focusProtect the engineering team from day to day ‘noise’Embed and optimise processes to handle our scope of work and new demandAssure SM’s position with the clientBuild and nurture relationships with clients at all levelsHelp to manage SM’s delivery riskBenefitsWorking at Simple MachinesWe’re looking for someone who’s as passionate as we are about building a world-class technology company specialising in engineering for data.Just some of the benefits of working with Simple Machines include:Flexible working: Want to work from home or leave early to pick up the kids? Need to start early some days, later on others? No problem!Generous parental leave: Three months’ fully paid primary carer leave and one month fully paid secondary carer leave, subject to a minimum 12 month tenureLearning and development: We all love continually learning and have a generous budget for you to upskill, join conferences, get certified and qualifiedLunch is on us. Always! We happily supply lunch at each of our office locations every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.

title: Product Manager
description:
It has never been a more exciting time to join the digitsation and decarbonization of the electricity industry. Clipsal Solar’s mission is to revolutionise the new energy landscape by digitising and creating brilliant experiences for customers globally. We have global intentions being backed by one of the world’s biggest energy management and technology automation companies, Schneider Electric Ventures. Over the past 12 months we have experienced tremendous growth and now we are looking for an experienced Product Manager to support our product team who has a passion for building highly engaging products at scale and launching them into new markets. We’re looking for a strategic thinker who is driven to achieve and can manage a portfolio of products powered by the Clipsal Cortex platform.•	The Clipsal Cortex app has won a Gold Good Design Award 2021 •	Strong Australian customer base with North American launch imminent •	Relentless customer experience and data visualisation focus•	Data science driven culture •	Start-up backed by global energy and tech company•	Awesome team, flexible work hoursAbout the RoleThis is a full-time, permanent position and will be either based in Sydney CBD or remote.Our product vision is to help empower customers to make better energy choices. We are looking for a Product manager who will report to the Head of Product. As a Product Manager, you will own a portfolio of products and define the roadmap and ship great features that drive engagement and retention. We’re looking for a creative thinker with a can do attitude. We offer a fast-paced and entrepreneurial work environment that rewards a relentless focus on quality and customer experience.Key Responsibilities•	Define and execute the product strategy and positioning for a portfolio of software products•	Be the voice of customer in the strategic and tactical decisions•	Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, software engineers and customers to build products which will lead to customer success and delight•	Responsible for the entire product lifecycle from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics and iterations•	Create product artefacts such as product strategy, roadmaps, customer experience maps and user journeys•	Proactively identify design problems and devise simple, intuitive solutions and iterate rapidly•	Track product metrics and reports to track success•	Conduct research, design, and user testing activities during the life cycle of a project•	Engage with internal and external stakeholders and users to synthesise feedback and translate them into insights for product iterations and new feature development.•	Take smart risks and evangelize new ideas.•	Stay abreast of the latest industry insights, tools and trends.Qualifications and Requirements•	Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in product management.•	Demonstrated experience with product management of business to consumer related software products and service (essential)•	Demonstrated experience with end-to-end software product lifecycle (concept to market roll out).•	Understands SaaS metrics and product-led growth principles and gets excited about diving into the data to unearth new growth opportunities.•	Excellent customer intuition; demonstrated success in creating beautifully simple, user-friendly products.•	Exceptional communication skills to liaise with internal and external stakeholders. •	Strong bias for action; ability to juggle multiple priorities and effectively deliver in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.•	Strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations and drive actions•	Experience planning and facilitating customer interviews, focus groups and other research to gather insights used to inform, frame and execute products.•	Strong understanding of product design thinking and UX research methodologies.•	Excellent skills with relevant software including but not limited to Google Analytics, Figma, Miro, Maze, Jira, Confluence, LogRocket etc.•	Ability to work in an agile environment, part of a multi-disciplinary team.•	Comfortable and confident in managing stakeholders’ expectations.•	Passion for learning and innovation, balanced with business needs and customer expectations.•	Experience in a startup environment.•	Experience in renewables industry (solar, energy storage, home energy management etc) is a plus.

A strong understanding of garment construction and capabilities is advantageous in this role.This role is based in sunny Sydney, Australia with a pet friendly office and offers a competitive salary and relocation package.Main responsibilities will include:Ensuring product aligns with business strategy and direction.Working closely with the General Manager on end-to-end design and production.Overseeing the production costing process, negotiating pricing with suppliers and manufacturers.Forecasting market trends by analysing consumer buying patterns, competitor pricing, researching and staying up-to-date with fast fashion trends.Effectively running fit sessions ensuring accurate and consistent fit of all garments.Liaising with the Creative Team to maintain consistent branding across product and marketing collateral.Managing the product team, providing leadership and guidance.Reviewing and updating processes with our manufacturers to achieve maximum efficiency.Building strong working relationships with all key stakeholders.Person Specifications:5+ years experience working across product, production, buying or technology.A team player with a positive and proactive attitude.Proven experience managing a team of Buyers, Designers and Garment TechsStrong understanding of the buying and design/production processes as well as procurement/supply chain function.Self-motivated and results-oriented.The ability to commercially interpret trends for the fast fashion customer.An innovator who knows which trends to start and which to follow.Self-motivated and results-oriented.

title: Product Manager
description:
We need great talent at ACCO Brands, and value different talents, aspirations and views to create a highly motivated, action-oriented atmosphere.Our winning team shares the ACCO Brands Vision of being a company that Achieves, Creates, Collaborates, and Organizes. We have a dynamic and healthy culture that is shaped by leaders and lived by employees at all levels.ACCO Brands Australia has a current career opportunity to join our Marketing team as a Product Manager in our Sydney Head Office location. You will be reporting into our Senior Brand Manager, whilst managing some of our largest of brands. We are after a Product Manager to focus on our Gaming range. As a key member of our dynamic Marketing team, you would be responsible for driving all aspects of the product life cycle, customer reviews and promotional activity across ANZ.This involves championing all promotions, point of sale, range reviews and execution requirements for all customers and the company, ensuring to raise the expectation and delivery of ACCOs portfolio of brands.You would completely own your assigned category and would be required to create and execute brand plans for your category. You would be required to do the following, but not limited to:Category Expense Tracking of your allocated budget.Forecasting, Planning and Executing stock plans for your category.Liaise with the product supplier or new manufacturing partners of all aspects of the product creation, artwork, design and sign off.Review portfolio and give recommendations on ways to continue to drive sales.Ownership of image / website / brochures database for your category.Effectively manage the product life cycle including exiting products and deletions.QualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent 3+ years of experience in Product Management;An understanding of GS1 and Microsoft Software Suite capability is required.Strong written, verbal and collaboration skillsyou need to have a ‘can-do’ attitude, strong interpersonal and communication skills and be comfortable working independently.This role is a hybrid work arrangement, covering 3 days in office and 2 days from home.

title: Product Manager
description:
Product Manager – Scientific DivisionLocated either: SYDNEY – MELBOURNE  ·        Life Science Industry·        International leading product portfolio·        Career OpportunityIn Vitro Technologies are the premier supplier for cell biology and translational research throughout Australia and New Zealand. We offer a range of consumables & reagents as well as core facility & specialised equipment (cell analysis & bioprocess) for our life science customers’ workflow in academic research, translational research, biotechnology and manufacturing. We specialise in application areas of Cancer, Neuroscience, Immunology, Cell & Gene therapy, and Bioprocess, amongst others.As a result of emerging opportunities in the scientific market segment, we are seeking to appoint additional full-time Product Managers to join our marketing team.Reporting to the Scientific Marketing Manager you will be responsible for defining and implementing key sales marketing initiatives to drive the profitability and sales of a portfolio of products as assigned. Responsibilities encompass the Australian and New Zealand markets. To be successful, you MUST have a minimum of 3-5 years of sales experience and previous product management experience is favoured. A scientific background preferably in the Life Science, Industrial Science and Biotechnology market segments is highly desirable. You will have excellent communication and presentation skills, be self-motivated and confident with the ability to close a sale. Preference will be given to candidates with local customer knowledge. Required skills & qualifications·        Post-graduate qualification in Life Science ·        Research experience in Life Sciences, preferably in Cell Biology, Immunology, and/or Translational Research·        Min 3+ years’ experience in Life Science sales·        Outstanding communication, scientific presentation and business development skills·        Strong work ethic, self-motivated, confident and engaging·        Knowledge of the life science and biotechnology landscape in Australia and New Zealand·        Commercial acumen: ability to identify and pursue commercial opportunities; providing solutions to meet customer needs·        High energy, self-motivation and ability to work autonomouslyBenefits·        Salary and incentives commensurate with your experience·        Car Allowance·        National Sales conference & team building activities·        ANZ travel ·        Training on new scientific technologies and products·        Professional development opportunities to enhance and broaden skill sets·        Laptop & Phone·        Free ParkingThe Scientific Unit at In Vitro Technologies includes a dynamic sales and marketing team who support a vision to serve the Australian and New Zealand life science market. We are committed to developing new staff in our team-based environment by providing support, guidance and on-going product and sales training to advance the skill set and capabilities of our team.Please forward your Application Cover Letter and CV by 20th March 2023 to:Dr Mala Reddy, Divisional Manager - ScientificEmail: mala.reddy@invitro.com.auView the Careers page on our website to learn more about our team: https://lifescience.invitro.com.au/l/careers

title: Senior Product Manager
description:
Product ManagerAre you looking for your next role in product management? Do you want to work for a company helping the environment? Do you want to be under the leadership of somebody who has worked at the likes of Apple, Google & Canva? Do you want to be helping to build products that make a significant positive impact to the lives of millions of Australians? If the answer is yes, then read on! If the answer is no, then read on anyway because It took me a while to write this! About the CompanyThey are redefining the transaction process to improve both the customer experience and the Retailer's & Bank's ability to harness the data digitally, building customer profiles. If this wasn't enough, they are also eliminating redundant paper receipts, saving the environment in the process (1 billion metres per year....) They are partnered with the largest banks & largest retailers in Australia, who are already implementing their technology & are paving the way for mass adoption across the entire country. Despite making huge waves over the past 6 years, they are still relatively small given their impact, meaning they remain agile, tight-knit & all pulling in the same direction. This year will see significant growth across Engineering & Product. This is your chance to become a significant part of a platform that will change how consumers transact forever. A bit about the role...This is a mature fintech scaleup with plenty of runway & established bluechip clientele Act as the senior product owner to cross- functional squads and closely partner with the Tech & design management Develop an in-depth understanding of the product and domain to act as the subject matter expert for the squadManage backlog for your squad, define and document product requirements (Epics, User stories and Acceptance criteria) and review features before they go to productionMake real-time decisions / prioritizations for your squad based on effort and impact through the build phase, you will be regularly attending squad ceremoniesEngage and motivate your squad with using the product vision and benefits to end usersPerks...Equity Uncapped paid annual leaveGiveback days, culture of recognition Generous L&D budgetParental Leave & Flex workPet friendly officesWhat we are looking for in you...Strong experience as a Senior Product Owner / Manager in an agile environmentFintech experienceStartup/scaleup experience Ability to build and manage product requirements for a cross-functional squadAbility to showcase product features and articulate their value to internal & external audienceExperience of balancing priorities in a complex, rapidly evolving environmentAbility to maintain stability for stakeholders in a volatile environmentStrong understanding of good UX principles Skills & Personality Get shit done mentality Friendly, go-getting attitude Obsessed with the customer & their journey Ability to gain the trust of engineers & designers & get them to work in harmony Ability to juggle multiple tasks at onceAlthough experience in Fintech is highly desirable, if you have had a hand in building awesome products in other industries - we would still love to speak to you!

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you a Managed Fund Product Maestro who would love to work for a growing, purpose led ASX listed company? This could be the opportunity you’ve been looking for!About UsAustralian Ethical is Australia’s original and fastest-growing super fund and ethical investment manager. We are ASX-listed with over $8 billion in funds under management and offer a selection of award-winning managed funds and superannuation products.Our purpose is to invest for a better world, and we have been pioneers in this space for over 30 years. For us, investing has two aims – generating solid financial returns and a positive impact for people, planet, and animals. At Australian Ethical, we prove that money can be a force for good. We do this by staying true to our purpose, which is embedded throughout our organisation and drives our everyday activities as a business, investor, brand, employer, and corporate citizen. We’re a registered B Corp and fully committed to an inclusive, equitable and forward-thinking workplace culture.Your New RoleIn this role you will be an integral part of the Product team providing technical expertise and leadership for all aspects of work with respect to our managed fund product portfolio. You’ll ensure our existing products are competitive in market, deliver on CVP, meet legislative and regulatory obligations, deliver on commercial outcomes and uphold our core values and beliefs. In addition to oversight of existing offerings, you’ll offer technical inputs for the product pipeline and future opportunities.Key responsibilities include:Implementing the product strategy for the managed fund investment portfolioIdentifying, designing and implementing product development and changes to features and pricingOptimising customer experience and identifying opportunitiesEvaluating competitiveness, cost and pricing and providing recommendations of solutions and improvementsManaging ongoing obligations in view of legislative and regulatory changesReviewing, updating and signing off on disclosure documents and marketing collateralKey vendor management, oversight of deliverables and ensuring ongoing efficacyPreparation of service level, vendor, product and board reports About YouWhether you’re at a boutique fund manager, or with one of the big investment houses you’re a technically strong, yet hands on product manager who inherently understands end to end product management. You’re a team player with highly developed interpersonal and relationship management skills who has a track record of successfully working across a business as well as vendors to deliver impactful outcomes in managed funds. If you have all, or most of the following, we’d love to hear from you:5+ years’ financial services experience in product or operations3+ years managed fund product management experienceProven success working across an organisation, and with vendors – including vendor management experienceDeep technical understanding of managed fund products, including end to end product lifecycle and value chainDemonstrated understanding of legislative and regulatory requirements and landscapeRelevant tertiary qualificationsYou can demonstrate and align with our values of: authenticity, wisdom, action and empathyWhat’s in it for youA competitive salary, including short-term and long-term incentives including access to an Employee Share PlanFlexible work arrangementsWellbeing program that includes an extra 5 days of leave above statutory requirementPurpose aligned volunteer days20 days paid annual leave with an additional 3 paid days of annual leave over the Christmas periodTo find out more about what it’s like to work at Australian Ethical, check out this link: https://www.australianethical.com.au/work-with-us/At Australian Ethical we embrace diversity in our people and thinking. We are committed to being an equal opportunities employer and never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.We believe supporting greater gender balance is key to our business growth and success, that’s why we’re proud to be one of eight organisations who have committed to the Financial Services Council (FSC) Women in Investment Charter. To find out more see here: https://www.fsc.org.au/policy/investment-management/gender-diversity/women-in-investment-management-charterJoin the TeamIf this role interests you and you'd love to join the Australian Ethical team, apply here via LinkedIn. We look forward to hearing from you!Please note: Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. Applications via and approaches from recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position

title: Product Manager - Canva Docs
description:
Canva’s Commitment and MissionAt Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 110+ million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 3,400 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.Join us and design your future.Product Management @ CanvaThe mission of Product Managers at Canva is to create the most accessible design tool for every person in the world. We believe that we can improve the world by empowering everyone to design and communicate visually.Product Managers collaborate with Canva’s founders to set the strategic direction, scope, and success metrics for product initiatives. We work across teams of designers, software engineers, marketers, and analysts to ensure we're delivering an exceptional experience to all our users. As our product grows, we are responsible for implementing and collaborating on product strategy, road mapping, and prioritisation.It’s our responsibility to see products through their entire lifecycle—from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics, and iterations.About The Editing GroupThe Editing group at Canva is responsible for delivering value to users through our world-class design editor. On our mission to empower everyone to design anything, we are always thinking about a wide range of user problems and building features to address a diverse set of use cases for the Canva editor. The Canva Editor empowers our users to do everything from collaborative whiteboarding to creating digital documentation with Canva Docs.The Canva Docs Team is focused on building a visual, engaging document editor that leverages the power of the rest of the Canva platform to deliver a truly unmatched experience for all our users.What You'll DoDefine a clear strategy and roadmap with the team and leadership that will deliver maximum value to Canva Docs usersHelp execute an effective discovery process for Canva DocsWork with designers to solve real problems through flawless user experiencesWork with your team of engineers to set (and hit) crazy, big delivery goals Become a trusted expert in all things online document editing Build relationships with key strategic integration partners, and seek to form new ones that unlock growth for Canva and our usersRecognise the biggest picture, communicate, collaborate, and compromise effectively with collaborators and other PMs for the best outcome for CanvaAbout YouProduct Management experience of a software product, with online document editing product knowledge as a huge plusYou have led large or multiple product teams through discovery and deliveryYou're someone who enjoys leading a team of amazing people to ship innovative solutions - and can point to an impressive record of doing soExceptional UX skills - you understand more than just the fundamentals of good UXAn excellent communicator who can influence cross-functionally with each to achieve big winsGreat with data (both qualitative and quantitative) and loves turning insights into actionsYou thrive on being in the middle of a cross-functional team, wearing lots of hats and doing whatever it takes to help your team and the business succeedWorking at CanvaOur culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.Whether you’re in the office, working from home or choosing your own adventure, our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. We have a hybrid work model (in-office & from home), with our offices are always open to you balancing flexibility and connection Flexible leave so you can recharge, give back, support others or focus on your own professional development. Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive, better than anyone. Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University, Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations, Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

title: Product Manager - Manage Teams
description:
Canva’s Commitment and MissionAt Canva, we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts, perspectives and expression is key to building the best product, team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So, even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes, we’d still love to hear from you!Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 110+ million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 3,400 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.Join us and design your future.Product Management @ CanvaThe mission of Product Managers at Canva is to create the most accessible design tool for every person in the world. We believe that we can improve the world by empowering everyone to design and communicate visually. As a Product Manager at Canva you help set this vision, define what that future looks like, and build the products and features that get us there.Product Managers collaborate with Canva’s founders to set the strategic direction, scope, and success metrics for product initiatives. We work across teams of designers, software engineers, marketers and analysts to ensure we're delivering an exceptional experience to all our users. We are responsible for implementing and collaborating on product strategy, road mapping, and prioritisation as our product grows.It’s our responsibility to see products through their entire lifecycle—from concept through to validation, build, post-launch analytics and iterations.About the Manage Teams Group @ Canva The Manage Teams Group is on a mission to empower large teams with flexible configuration and team management capabilities. The group is responsible for driving core product capabilities and seamless user experiences for teams to set up and manage Canva so their team members can thrive! This group is working on a number of exciting initiatives that have a huge impact on Canva’s overall strategy and growth.The People Management team is responsible for all features relating to helping customers to organise people in a team, from team invitations, creating groups, auto-provisioning of users to UX/UI of People Page in Canva. This team owns one of the key strategic pillars for the Manage Teams Group, and plays a critical role in winning large organisations to set up and use Canva. You will also have the opportunity to define the next stage of the People Management vision and the roadmap!What You'll Be DoingDevelop, own and execute the roadmap and strategy for our People Management teamServe as a domain expert on organising people in a Team, to help large organisations provision and manage their users in Canva.Be a leader for your team along with your Design Lead and Engineering Lead, by rallying the team to buy into your product vision and roadmap, and driving the team to work towards the goalsWork alongside a passionate, cross-functional team of engineers, marketers and designers to execute the roadmap and deliver an amazing experience to our users.Work on high priority growth goals for one of our newest Canva worksuite offerings.Set crazy big goals for your team, and hit them!Skills We're Looking ForStrong experience as a product manager of a SaaS software product, with experience working at scale a huge plus.Someone who enjoys leading a team of amazing people to ship innovative solutions - and can point to an impressive record of doing so.A strong communicator - can speak the language of engineering, data, design, operations and can coordinate cross-functionally with each to achieve big wins.Strong UX skill set. Understands more than just the fundamentals of good UX, loves Canva’s seamless and simple design and is going to be ruthless in protecting it.Someone who can generate insight based on vision, data and user feedback, clearly define a direction for a team and then execute in a fast-paced environment to deliver customer value and delightful experiences. An ownership mentality and high agency to get projects from concept to reality as quickly as possible! The ability to move ideas from the chaos of brainstorming and mock-ups to the clarity of execution and impact.What does the first 3-6 months look like?Settle in and learn about your team and how users and admins are using our people management features and their key pain pointsRun the daily PM rituals and work with the team to deliver and launch a number of the exciting features and capabilities for our usersDive deep into the people management vision and user / admin needs, and define a roadmap for the next season.What You'll Learn As a Product Manager At CanvaYou’ll learn how to think big, really big and take 10x bets You’ll learn to focus on the long term whilst making rapid progress in the short term.You’ll learn about working at a founder led company with mission, values and a genuine desire to be a force for good in the world at the heart of everything we do You’ll learn how to build products that serve tens of millions of people all around the worldYou’ll learn how to be a visual thinker. When you think you’ve made something as simple as possible, at Canva you’ll learn how to make it even simplerYou learn how to push the boundaries and use your passion and creativity to solve problem that have never been solvedWorking at CanvaOur culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.Whether you’re in the office, working from home or choosing your own adventure, our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. We have a hybrid work model (in-office & from home), with our offices are always open to you balancing flexibility and connection Flexible leave so you can recharge, give back, support others or focus on your own professional development. Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive, better than anyone. Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University, Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations, Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.
