title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Company DescriptionWho are Smiling Mind?Smiling Mind is Australia’s leading digital-led, prevention focused mental health, not-for-profit. We are the innovators behind Australia’s most trusted mental wellbeing app, and we have been helping minds thrive for over 10 years by equipping Australians with the essential psychological skills to build their mental fitness. We help people learn these skills in fun and interactive ways that are accessible anywhere and anytime.So far, we’ve reached more than 4 million people through our renowned mindfulness app, as well as more than 220,000 Australian teachers and more than 6 million Australian children and young people through our programs - but this is just the beginning.Imagine if every young person had the skills they needed to thrive, face challenges with resilience and ultimately, suffer less from mental illness. This is our vision for the future and by 2030, we aim to create this generational change in Australia’s mental health.Job DescriptionWHO ARE YOU?Ever looked at our app and thought “they could improve it if they just……” Yes? Great!We’re looking for a UX/UI Designer who is excited to work on our beautiful suite of digital products (app and web platform) which reach our global user base. Our app is loved by users from around the world, and our digital education platform is in classrooms all across Australia.You are a passionate and creative designer, who believes that accessible and impactful digital experiences will be key to realising a generational change in Australia’s mental health; especially for kids. You will have a genuine passion for public health, and an enthusiasm for implementing design solutions which support positive outcomes for all our users, especially kids.You will have experience in interface and experience design, especially for native app and web-based products. Working closely with the Product Managers, your goal is to ensure a great user experience and to deliver on our organisational OKRs.As Smiling Mind’s UX/UI Designer, you will primarily be working closely with the Product team to understand business requirements and to translate them into new solutions, features and sometimes even new products. From time to time, you may also collaborate with the marketing team to apply your expertise to improving the user journey flows in the Smiling Mind website.You will be focused on learning about our digital products, deeply understanding our users and their needs, conducting user research, creating user-friendly wireframes, journey maps and prototypes, and seeing them through to finished designs. You will also be responsible for the development of the digital product style guide and associated documentation.Please note, this role is initially a contract position until the end of 2023, which we hope we will be able to extend.QualificationsWE’RE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHOIs a natural problem solver and strategic thinker, who can collaborate and create efficient and effective processes to deliver on the strategy. Has a strong analytical mind and ability to break down problems to design appropriate solutions. Can operate autonomously in solving problemsHas an inquisitive nature, with a high degree of curiosity. You love to collaborate and share your knowledge with the wider team. Has solid communication skills (written and verbal), with a positive attitude to problem solving and ability to work within teams to find solutions. Enjoys working in a multidisciplinary team who collaborate effectively to achieve exceptional results. YOU’VE GOT:3+ years of UX/UI Design experience with strong expertise in app and web design in a product-led organisationA portfolio of professional design work for both web and mobile platforms. Expertise in standard design tools such as FigmaKnowledge of UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design. Experience collaborating with Product Managers, Data Scientists and Engineers in a software development environmentAbility to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teamsA clear understanding of the importance of user-centered design and design thinkingAbility to research design trends and movements and see how this can potentially be transferred into your workBe passionate about resolving user pain points through great design and to iterate designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritise tasks. Additional InformationWe Love People Who…Believe in the purpose and philosophy of Smiling MindHave a desire to have a positive impact on the world – particularly through behaviour change and learning designThe ability to blend agility and pace, with the rigour required to deliver impactful health servicesStrong business acumenA growth mindset and willingness to learnHave attention to detail, accountability, and ability to work to timelines and manage competing tasksA warm, friendly, collaborative, and engaging approach Alignment to our values We're a friendly and highly driven small team with a big dream so expect to be surrounded by people who are passionate about changing the future generations of Australians. 'Smart Hustle' is a state of mind in a not-for-profit, but we are certainly not your standard. Smiling Mind is a high growth, fast paced organisation more akin to a tech start-up than what you might perceive a not-for-profit to be like.We know that strong commercial outcomes equate to greater impact. Our people have tenacity, creativity, and resilience in spades, meaning we punch well above our weight, working together as a tight knit team to achieve great things.You will be expected to use initiative to get the job done, will be challenged to perform at your very best, and in return get the opportunity to learn from inspiring and skilled team members achieving life changing results for our community.Other perks include salary sacrificing and Collingwood based warehouse office which is most definitely dog friendly.It is our goal that Smiling Mind continues to evolve as a culturally safe and welcoming organisation to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children, young people, families, and communities. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply for this position. Smiling Mind is a child safe organisation and is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of all children, at all times. All offers of employment are subject to satisfactory background checks including, but not limited to, Working with Children Check and Referee Checks.

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Our mission at Ofload is to achieve zero waste in trucking by digitising the transport industry.In Australia, currently 30% of trucks drive empty and a further 50% are underutilised amounting to mass inefficiency and detrimental environmental impacts. Since 2020 we have scaled to a team of over 100, removed nearly 5 million empty kilometres from our roads. and have planted over 11 000 trees to offset our carbon footprint in partnership with One Tree Planted.In 2022, we supercharged our growth through the acquisition of logistics experts CIA Logistics, raised $60m in Series B funding and were recognised by the Australian Financial Review as one of Australia's Most Innovative Companies.We are looking to grow our team and welcome people excited by the opportunity to disrupt the logistics industry!What you'll do:Develop a strong understanding of our users through research and user interviewsIdentify key insights and effectively communicate them through personas, journeys, wireframes and prototypesDesign high fidelity, responsive UI designs for hand off to developmentIterate on designs based on feedback and testing with usersActively collaborate within cross functional teams that include other designers, engineers, and product managers, sometimes in different time zonesContribute, grow and maintain our design systemChampion consistency in interaction design across the entire ecosystemRequirementsAbout youYou are someone who:Is driven to solve interesting and complex problems that provide value to humansIs excited to join a bright team of industry disruptorsIs curious with a natural passion for developing their craftHas a strong understanding of user experience and design principlesAsks clarifying questions and challenges assumptionsCan actively seek and receive feedbackIs a penchant for details and organisationSolid practical experience in UX/UI and visual designAbility to own the end-to-end design process on selected topicsStrong understanding of interaction and visual design principles and processesHigh proficiency with relevant software, tooling and methodologies. (eg: Figma, Zeplin, Sketch Adobe programs and/or similar)Excellent communication and ability to collaborate with cross functional teams in tech, product, data or from the wider business to deeply understand the problemExperience working in an Agile environment, helping to navigate ambiguity to influence the design directionExperience contributing and using design systemsBenefitsLife at OfloadAt Ofload, our values are in our DNA and underpin the work we do every day. We are proud of the collaborative, diverse and innovative culture we continue to build. The Ofload team is motivated by a shared ambition to digitise the logistics industry and have a truckload of fun while doing it! As well as the opportunity to join a high-growth organisation with the ability to make a meaningful impact everyday, you will enjoy;Working in a hybrid environment with a split of in-office and working from home. Our philosophy on working is one built around connection, inclusion and flexibility.Holistic wellness support for you and your family through our wellbeing partnership with Acacia ConnectionGenerous parental leave entitlements including 16 weeks primary caregiver leave and continued superannuation contributionsAnnual learning and development budget to support your professional growthPaid volunteer leave to support the causes that matter to youPlus all the exciting perks of joining a startup - epic Ofload swag, weekly catered breakfasts, monthly team lunch, a reward and recognition program and plenty of social events.Ofload is committed to building diverse and inclusive teams, and a culture where people can bring their whole authentic selves to work each day. Applications are highly encouraged from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; and equity target groups including women, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, people with disabilities, and people who identify as LGBTIQA+.We endeavour to create an equitable recruitment process with an even playing field for all candidates. If you require any adjustments to be made, please let a member of our recruitment team know.

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
Exciting opportunity for a UX / UI Designer to work on a greenfields mobile app.Join NOVON as out next contracted UX/UI Designer to work on an exciting project based on our customer site. This role will involve you working with a dynamic team on a mobile apps project. It is a fantastic opportunity to further develop your skills. Living our values to Be Innovative, Be Humble and Be Yourself – Become our next NOVONian!Working in a team lead by the Digital Delivery Manager, this UX UI Designer role will involve you working on a greenfields mobile app. You will be responsible for the successful UX UI of digital mobile app developed in React Native. As a UX/UI designer you will work on ensuring that the products are designed with elements of HCD and useability to increase take up of this new mobile application.Tasks You Will Be Involved WithWork closely and collaboratively with key stakeholders and product ownersLead and implement design and ensuring consistency throughout the design process working with UX metrics.Designing a product that meet the needs of the user by engaging with cliental (user interviews, user stories, hifi, lofi)Presenting research to stakeholders and keeping other teams up to date with trendsWorking in an agile environmentExperience creating high-fidelity mock-ups, wireframes and prototypes At NOVON we are an organisation that values the whole consultant and invites you to bring your whole self to work. We reward our teams with not only exciting projects and a positive work environment but also provide great benefits like:Paid parental leaveGifted leave up to an additional 20% on statutory requirementsFormal coaching and mentoringCareer growth and further education/training Get in touch with us to discuss these great opportunities or email your c.v to careers@novon.com.au

title: UX / UI Designer
description:
Mid Level UX / UI DesignerThe Company:We are currently looking for a skilled Mid UX/UI designer in Sydney to join a global leading technology company in a very niche and exciting business. With strong foundations in design and collaboration with companies around the world in the aerial technology space. As part of the team, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology with a focus on designing user-centric solutions, and be a part of a tech revolution! Reporting to the Vice President of Design you will have the opportunity to work closely with their Australian and U.S. teams, gaining global exposure and experience on complex projects.About the Role:Overall, as a UX/UI designer, you will be responsible for creating designs that are not only visually appealing but also highly usable and user-friendly.In this role, you will be responsible for conducting user research, creating user personas, developing wireframes, designing prototypes, creating high-fidelity designs, conducting usability testing and collaborating with developers to ensure that the designs are implemented correctly. Responsibilities, Duties and Expectations:Enhance and improve the existing designsDevelop user flows and functional prototypes using design tools such as Figma.Pay close attention to details to ensure a high-quality design.Conduct user testing to gather feedback and insights.Provide a seamless user experience throughout the design process.Adhere to typography and graphic design style standards to maintain consistency.Qualifications and Skills:At least 2 years of experience in UX/UI or Product Design.Bachelor's degree in UX/UI design, Product Design, or a related field.Strong conceptual thinking, interaction, and visual design skills to create effective designs.Excellent communication skills.Preferred experience in website design and/or web development, and the willingness to learn new tools and technologies.Understanding of the software development process and experience working with Agile/Scrum.Ability to handle multiple projects and complete (realistic) deadlines.If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, please don't hesitate to APPLY! For The Latest Jobs, Tech News or to 'Introduce A Friend' for a $1000 Referral Fee - Follow Us On Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroupTheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry. We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.If you have the right skills and attitude we would love to hear from you!

title: UI Designer
description:
DescriptionWho are we?Lyka is an Australian founded pet wellness company that’s shaking up an outdated industry and paving the way for happier, healthier pets. Sadly, statistics have shown us that approximately eighty percent of pets are suffering from dental disease, with one in every three being diagnosed with cancer, and forty-one percent overweight. As humans we are acutely aware of the positive impact fresh wholefoods can have on our health and wellbeing, however the same hasn’t always been said for our furry friends. We're on a mission to change that, starting with nutritionally balanced, wholefood meals delivered direct to doors around Australia. As the world’s most sustainable pet wellness company, we’re putting pets and our planet first.Today, we are proud to share we’ve served and fed over 10 million meals to puppers and their parents across Australia, and this is just the beginning. Our vision is to create multiple nutritional products, adding disease prevention meals and supplements, and take Lyka into new markets.Currently, we have a team of 140 pet-obsessed people on our team who share our vision. These carefully selected people are dedicated to building the next generation of technology and products to help empower pet parents to take control over their pet’s wellbeing. To date, we have raised over $40M in funding from our venture fund investments and pet industry insiders, who believe in our mission and ability to drive change in an outdated industry, providing nutrition that nourishes puppers from the inside out.Are you ready to shake things up and give pets the life they deserve? Come join your people.The RoleWe value innovation and creativity in all aspects of product design from concept to execution. As a UI Designer, you will be responsible for creating engaging user interface designs across various web platforms and devices. You should have an eye for clean design with excellent attention to detail. We’re searching for a UI Designer who is early in their career and wants the opportunity to get a tonne of exposure to a broad range of Service and Product Design work. This role will initially (~6 months) focus on building ~150 landing pages however, then have a development opportunity to move into a Product Designer role.Your primary responsibilities include designing landing pages, website graphics, icons, typography elements etc using tools such as Figma or other software programs like Unbounce.RequirementsBachelor's degree in Graphic Design or related field is preferred Proven experience (1-3 years) as UI/UX Designer or similar role Excellent knowledge of Figma and other tools (we currently use Unbounce) Knowledgeable about modern graphic design trends Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams Strong problem solving skills along with great attention to detail A portfolio demonstrating exceptional ability in graphic design Experience operating in an ever changing business, and comfortable delivering in this environment. Finally, you have got to be passionate about our products and love animals! BenefitsWork in a fast-growing start-up, experiencing what goes behind the scenes to sustain hyper-growth for a start-up with a physical product!Growth and Development – Lyka is growing extremely quickly, which means you will have the opportunity to experience different challenges every day and progressively acquire more responsibilities as our facility and team expands. We provide an annual L&D budget for you to continue your personal development. Work for a sustainability focused company – we care about the health of our dogs & our planet. Not only are we the only Australian carbon-negative pet food company, but we’re also working on offsetting all our staff's plastic use & carbon emissions, too!Be part of a diverse top talent team, coming from widely different backgrounds and geographies12 weeks of paid parental leave for primary carers and 6 weeks for secondary carers, alongside 2 weeks of miscarriage leave in the first twenty weeks. We also offer 18 paid weeks to both primary & secondary carers if you have been at Lyka for over two years. Wellbeing assistance & tools to take care of your mental & physical wellbeing so you can do your best work. Flexible working: work from where you get your best work done. We have pet-friendly offices in Sydney and Melbourne and offer a WFH allowance for your home setup. Pupper parent support to care for your furry friends – flexible arrangements for new pets, pet-friendly offices, discounts & a financial allowance for dog training & care to help them live their best life!The majority of our team are based in Sydney, however we are open to applicants across Australia. We are committed to building inclusive and diverse teams.Lyka is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We celebrate diversity, are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.

title: UI/UX Designer (Expressions of Interest)
description:
At Bilue, we're always on the look out for talented designers to join our team and even though we're not actively hiring for this role, we'd love to connect and stay in touch for future opportunities.Perhaps you're not currently looking for a new role either, but interested to know more about the kind of work we get up to, our current design team and everything else happening at Bilue!By completing your details below, we'll add you to our Design Talent Community so you're kept up to date with any events we think you might be interested in, and kept top of mind for opportunities which match your skillset and capability.About Bilue:For 12+ years we have worked with some of Australia’s biggest brands, delivering innovative experiences. Originally founded in mobile development, Bilue is now a design and technology leader across mobile, cloud, web, enterprise integrations, TV and emerging technologies.We offer the end-to-end capabilities of a large agency with the attitude and approach of a nimble independent. We create multi-disciplined teams that form close collaborative relationships with our clients and third party vendors.Bilue = Big + Blue OceanThe philosophy behind this came from the early days when we viewed companies that weren't investigating mobile technologies as landlocked. We saw them as being stuck where they are, not able to move forward, not off exploring.This was and still is an opportunity for us to seize, because at Bilue, we see ourselves as shepherds. Taking our clients confidently out into the Big Blue Ocean where we can explore new opportunities together.Our vision is to 'mobilise millions' with our mission to unlock exponential growth for our clients, by creating inspired experiences on intelligent platforms. We strive for excellence, but we thrive on human connection, putting people at the heart of business transformation.We visualise ideas. Fast. Prototyping enables rapid feedback and iterative development. We then design beautiful, elegant interfaces that scale perfectly across multiple devices.In order to be considered for a role in our design team, you must have:Minimum 3-4 years commercial experience working on the UX/UI design of native mobile and web productsA solid baseline understanding of principles in both UI and UX design in:Preparing, running and processing user research and interviewsMapping - information architecture, user journeys, value propositions and personasIdeation of solutions, in collaboration with senior staff, client and technical stakeholdersPrototyping - low, mid and high fidelity clickable prototypesUser testingUser Interface designCompleted both qualitative and quantitative research and understand how findings convert into a market solution within real world business constraintsExperience interacting with stakeholders, both internal and externalPractical experience with Agile methodologies including design sprints and rapid prototypingNB. Must have full working rights within AustraliaInstagram: @bilue.officialWebsite: https://bilue.com.au

title: User Experience Designer
description:
At Stomble we're an exciting startup looking for a talented UX & UI Designer to join our team. We are a company with a strong core value, belief in culture and driving the best possible experience to our users. We value people who bring fresh new ideas, strategies, enthusiasm and love what they do. Our mission is to increase the awareness of businesses globally. This is our core driver for why we as an organization do what we do and why we create the change we are striving for. We believe that building the infrastructure for today will provide opportunities for those of tomorrow.Responsibilities:Working with Figma. (Essential)Cross functional team discussions.Develop and present documentation, user flows, annotated wireframes, and interactive prototypes.Research.Ability to apply design thinking to any situation and flow.The team will require you to help find solutions to current and future designs.We will teach and work very closely with you so you can develop and improve your skills. You'll have the opportunity to learn from other team members within Stomble with many opportunities to get your hands dirty working on real projects, you will be given challenging problems to solve, whilst being encouraged to find solutions. Your role will include:· Working closely with our engineering team to design and solve challenging problems.· Working on Figma to design low, mid and high-fidelity wireframes.· Working in cross functional team environments.· Ability to break down challenging problems.- Researching and learning. As a designer at Stomble, you will be implementing features and functionalities which will be driving us and our user forward. Your skills and knowledge will empower, create and drive our UX/UI team to design, fix and curate better ways to drive engagement with our customers. Your involvement in our design team is critical to our success. This is perfect for you if you:Have strong background in creative thinking and problem solving.Can devise strategies.Have strong verbal and written communication skills.Have strong knowledge of psychology.Design and have worked on previous projects previously.Have a strong desire to learn, ask questions and grow as a designer.MUST have 1-2 years experience in Figma (advantageous).MUST have knowledge on design principles.Dedicated to learning, improving and working with an exceptional team.Do not apply if you:Are not an Australia Resident, citizen or located in the country.Cannot participate in an unpaid internship. The most exciting part of working at Stomble is that you will be a part of the founding team, helping to build an incredible culture and atmosphere that makes our business strive. This is a full-time position, and you must be available to work for a minimum of 4-6 months in duration. If this sounds like you, we are excited to hear from you!

title: Product UX/UI Designer
description:
Come join one of the world’s fastest growing tech startups in mining!CorePlan is the world's only digital operations platform for mining. We’re not only empowering and modernising the way that people in mining work together, but making it smarter than ever before imagined.Since 2020, we have seen phenomenal business growth for us with over 10x the number of customers which includes brands such as Chalice, BHP and Sandfire.Our team is small but we are gearing for growth to double our team size so we can scale across mining here, in Australia, and internationally.What your role is:You will be part of the product development process from the get-go. You will lead the product discovery and design process for our mobile app and web platform, translating user workflow pain points into product design solutions.You will join a tight-knit product team that values good design and prides themselves in shipping the modern, intuitive software that our users know and love.What you will be doing:Become a product expert: gain a thorough understanding of the industry we play in, our end users, and why they choose to use (and love) our softwareUser research and discovery: map out user journeys, workflows and pain-points based on a thoroughly researched understanding of the different job roles of our customers and frame them as design problems to be solvedProduct design: design world-class, user-centric solutions all the way from conceptualisation, to user acceptance, to high-fidelity prototypesMaintain design standards: define and maintain product design standards and principles, ensuring they are consistent and follow modern web and mobile application best-practicesGuarantee product quality and success: gather user feedback and iterate on designs through data-driven feedback processesCommunicate and collaborate with internal teams for continuous feedback and stakeholder alignmentWe're looking for each other if you:Are a master at Figma Have demonstrable at least 2 years end-to-end experience in the delivery of design projects, from conceptualisation to productionHave a deep understanding of modern product discovery practices and love conducting them: user interviews, user acceptance testing, etc.Believe in user-centric design and value simplicity in solving design problemsAre able to communicate concepts and solutions effectively in a way that clearly articulates the reasoning behind design decisionsRecognise the importance of a smooth user experience: you have a passion for streamlining both software and workflow processesAlways strive for both professional and personal self-improvement: you’re inherently curious and you’re always learningHave a strong understanding of the software development process: experience of Agile/Scrum is a plusWhy you should care about this role:You’ll be innovating for a modern software platform which is revolutionising the mining industry - by understanding the need to put users firstInteresting design problems in unique environments across a wide variety of user rolesAutonomy and ownership over the work you do, with flexible working hoursA laid-back but professional workplace with a team of extraordinary, motivated and fun co-workersA brand-spanking-new MacbookWhy CorePlan?We are a modern SaaS startup born out of Western Australia and having achieved product-market fit in 2020, we are ready to rapidly scale the business.Expect autonomy, responsibility and problem solving like you've never imagined, in a growth-focused environment. We work with impact, surrounded by like-minded people who are unusually committed and who love what they do.Our mission at CorePlan is to help people in the mining industry work better together in the modern age. And, that’s why we have built the world’s easiest to use (and only) digital operations platform for mining.How to ApplyApplying is simple, but like with all good things, it takes time. While we know your resume looks great, our company culture is a big part of who we are and so we’d like to know a bit about who you are. Please, do us (and yourself) a favour by telling us how great you are so that we can skip the formalities and get down to business!

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
We're looking for contractors with passion and purpose to advocate for the customer through human-centred design.About Thought CollaborativeWe are a boutique Human-Centred Design agency. We help teams grow, consult and we have a passion for making a difference in the work lives of our team so that they can drive long term impact on our clients. We give our clients the power to ideate, create, and deliver products and services that serve customers to achieve their goals. We solve challenges that range from visual designs all the way to an abstract thought or idea. We solve these through facilitated collaboration. That is why we call ourselves Thought Collaborative.WE USE OUR CRAFT FOR SOCIAL IMPACTWe empower parents in developing nations with business principles so that they can create their own economic opportunities and transform their communities. In other words, we user our customer-centred design skills to help communities design chicken coops, market stalls, schools and more.About The ClientOur client is one of Australia’s largest financial institutions that is a household name. This organisation has been at the forefront for development Human-Centred Design in their field and continues to value and invest in their capability.About The WorkAn Experience Designer helps define customer journeys to ensure a consistent and valuable experience for customers and staff. They help achieve through the application of style and aesthetics to ensure that digital interfaces are easy to understand, engaging, consistent and on brand, whilst aligning to backend operations, processes, data and infrastructure.As a senior Experience Designer, you will be working with a multidisciplinary team of squad members and business stakeholders focussed on designing simple and seamless experiences. You will work closely with the project team members and be expected to present to stakeholders/partners/clients and work collaboratively with your team to improve our customers financial wellbeing.About Your Skills 4+ years of design experience across digital experiences. A strong background in Visual and UX design. Solid knowledge of UI design principles and techniques. Ability to perform in a fast paced, high stress design process. Confidence with a range of design software tools (e.g. Figma, Adobe Suite) whilst being open and adaptive to new trends and technologies. Good stakeholder management, storytelling and influencing skills. Ability to present messages in a clear, concise, and articulate manner. Coach and guide teams to apply a design led approach when developing solutions. A growth mindset, resilient nature, and an ability to cope and support others during uncertainty Commercially savvy with strong results focus.Most of all we want someone that plays nicely with others and puts the people at the heart of their designs. By people, we mean both your team, stakeholders and the user.How To ApplyInterested? Great, apply with your CV, examples of your work and a brief cover letter as to why you are the right fit.Web: hit apply in this advertisementEmail: careers@thoughtcollaborative.com.au

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
**Please only apply if you currently have Eligibility to work in Australia**Here at DotDev, we think creatively about technology and eCommerce; delivering innovative digital solutions of all shapes and sizes. We love envisioning how people will experience eCommerce, allowing for more personalised; socially connected and smooth experiences.After launching in 2016, we’ve built hundreds of eCommerce sites for some of the best in the business - partnering with Australian and global retailers such as Decjuba, Aje, Incu, Tony Bianco, Scanlan Theodore, Viktoria & Woods and more. We’re passionate about creating amazing, pixel-perfect and meaningful digital experiences. Sounds exciting? That’s because it is! And it’s where you come in…Who is a Senior UI/UX Designer at DotDev?As a Senior UI/UX Designer at DotDev, you are excited by establishing brands as industry leaders in eCommerce through well-produced and intelligently designed stores.Working closely with the Design Lead and UI Designer or sometimes solo: you’ll help transform user insights into smart, innovative and creative concepts. You will thoughtfully design experiences that are clear, accessible and delightful; using data to make meaningful design choices.With your UX Design thinking, clients & the team at Dotdev will rely on your ability to think outside of the box. You are someone who can draw various sources of data to paint an empathetic picture of the customer and their user journey navigating through a website.As a senior, you’ll also naturally mentor other designers and share knowledge on design methods, tools and trends with the rest of your team. You’ll help our team navigate ambiguity; negotiate decisions and support our designers when they feel out of their depth in the space.You also enjoy taking an active role in contributing to our design culture and practices - with a 'here to help' attitude. You absolutely, fundamentally believe that we're better together.So, that all sounds nice, but what will you be doing day-to-day?RequirementsAs a Senior UI/UX’er you will be responsible for:Orchestrating what best practice design looks like within the teamCreating beautiful and functional websitesPartnering with our UX Lead and Tech Leads to come up with the best solutions to user problems and client needsUnderstanding user data to empathise with the end userJumping in UX/customer research to better understand how a customer navigates a websiteDeveloping high-quality and organised design systems and creative concepts (prototypes)Turning client brand guidelines and objectives into tangible on-brand designs, even when they don’t necessarily fit with your own personal aestheticLeading creative & UX workshops as well as reviewsAs the subject matter specialist, help educate clients on best practice UI & UX practicesHelping others’ in the team where necessary and also asking for help when you don’t know something yourselfWhat skills do you need?Eligibility to work in AustraliaMust be at a senior designer levelA user-centred, solution and result mindsetBe flexible in the face of changing requirements throughout the design processExpert knowledge of FigmaBenefitsWhy work with us?A career at DotDev stretches you in all the right places. That’s because we’re always looking forward – future-proofing ecommerce requires futuristic skills! You’ll flex and grow, here – we don’t believe in boxes. We’ll help you design the kind of role, career, and work-life where you can be your best.Also, when we say flex, we mean it. Work-from-home is here to stay. Which means if the world outside calls your name, you can plug in from anywhere – Melbourne, Rome, or Tokyo.We’re remote-first (and loving it!). But we also have co-working offices in Melbourne & Brisbane, so when you do want that face-to-face time we have a space ready to go.Do work you're proud of. Apply today.

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
WeAreDigital is a strategic digital commerce and transformation consultancy.WeAre driven by a strong inclusive culture and a passion for working in teams. We have a relentless focus on making commerce better and easier - everyday. We craft digital strategies, products, services, campaigns that make a measurable difference to our clients and their customers. We are a diverse tribe that are looking for new members to bring a new perspective and experience, to help shape the future of our business. We strive to always create value, learn and share as much as possible with othersIf you want to be part of a growing and dynamic multi disciplinary team that works together with our clients to develop world class digital products, services and programmes that help their customers on the path to purchase then this could be the role for you.Your MissionThe Senior UI/UX Designer will contribute to the design process, as carried out by all core disciplines within the design team (including information architecture, experience design and visual/interface design, and interaction design).You will work closely with our designers, developers, strategists and client leads to:1/ champion our design process and advocate for our clients and their customers to be at the centre of everything we do2/ create world class commerce and transformation experiences across our broad range of local and global clients spanning ecommerce, enterprise, retail and consumer industries.RequirementsAs the Senior UI/UX Designer you will:Work closely with our clients to help craft and create solutions from project definition workshops and roadmapping sessions through to wireframes, prototypes and design delivery.Integrate with our team of strategists and researchers to create simple solutions to complex customer and business problems.Advocate and educate our team and clients on the importance of user centred design while meeting critical business goalsBe at the forefront of online retail and have a passion for driving conversion and resultsUnderstand what it means to be part of a premium digital consultancyHave a 'get Sh#$ done' attitude and also be able to have fun along the way.Be driven, motivated, enthusiastic and compelled every morning when you wake up to drive innovative challenges through to completion.Look forward to receiving internal and client feedback, be prepared to defend your decisions and update your positions in the face of changing business goals and requirements.BenefitsWe are constantly working on improving our benefits and how we look after our tribe.We believe in a healthy work environment that provides flexibility for everyone..Professional development through training, attending workshops and events is encouraged along with a bunch of other perks like a flexible work week, great coffee and an open & collaborative work environment.Our work environment is very open, honest and creative. We believe in creating a space where everyone can feel at home and bring their full selves to work everyday.ApplyIf this sounds like you we would love to hear from you. Please apply as soon as possible to be considered, by sending us your CV and a covering letter - including your salary expectations.No recruiters please (and thank you)Know someone perfect for this role? Refer them to the job, and you’ll earn a $1,500 bounty when they pass probation. Just ask them to note your name when applying.

title: User Interface Designer
description:
Company IntroductionWe are a young startup based in Australia. At Mochi Labs, we're inventing a new medium to share and organise knowledge. Our platform is a collaborative social network for educators, students, and life-long learners. Building on top of machine learning and computer vision research, our product revolutionises the conventional method of learning and teaching.Job DescriptionWe are looking for an experienced and talented UI designer to design and shape unique, user-centric products and experiences. The ideal candidate will have experience working in agile teams, with developers, UX designers and copywriters. You will be able to make deliberate design decisions and translate any given user-experience journey into a smooth and intuitive interaction.Employment typeFixed term contract (3 - 6 months), possible to convert to full-time after the contract ends. Working arrangementson-site or hybrid SalaryNegotiableResponsibilitiesBe a great team player, experienced in working with agile teams. Ability to collaborate closely with developers, and UX designers.Create, improve and use wireframes, prototypes, style guides, user flows, and effectively communicate your interaction ideas using any of these methods.Present and defend your design decisions. All your design decisions should be based on the overall design roadmap as well as your own design thinking and fundamental principles (e.g. color theory and visual weight).Continually keep yourself and your design team updated with the latest changes in your industry’s standards.RequirementsAt least 2 years of experience and proven track record.Strong portfolio to be presented and defended during the interview.Hands-on experience creating wireframes, prototypes, storyboards, user flows, etc.Experience using tools such as Figma.Creative ideas with problem-solving mindset.Experience working in an agile/scrum development process.Be open to receiving objective criticism and improving upon it.How to applyPlease send your resume and a link to your portfolio to jobs@mochilabs.com.au . Please do not apply via 'Apply now' button on Linkedin.

title: UX/UI Designer - Remote in Australia
description:
We’re looking for an experienced UX/UI Designer to join our awesome remote team of UXer’s. This role will suit someone who has experience in visual design and is a divergent thinker. You enjoy the initial free-flowing stages of the design process, generating and considering multiple ideas before converging into a refined solution. You have a love of solving problems and working collaboratively to design great products. How this role fits into our teamBeing a UX/UI Designer, you play a crucial role in designing our products to be intuitive, beautiful, and accessible. You are comfortable working within a multidisciplinary team and also autonomously. Our UX team have a user-focussed mindset and advocate for user needs at all stages of a product life cycle. You are comfortable working in early discovery and definition stages for a product, and your strengths lie across rapidly concepting solutions which can be tested and refined into working solutions. You are adaptable and pragmatic, being able to spot a better way of doing things or responding to a change or new requirements. We partner closely with our clients, so being able to establish good relationships with stakeholders and work with a variety of people will help you succeed in this role. You know how to foster relationships that make UX a team sport, striving for the best solutions, not your ‘own solution’. All our UX team are LUMA-certified professionals - and you’ll get the chance to join them!ResponsibilitiesFacilitate human-centred design activities with stakeholders and users to understand user needs, business goals and priorities.Ideate and explore a range of possible design solutions using collaborative and co-creation techniques.Research and validate with users, and synthesise findings to inform design directionCreate screen flows and define interaction rules to communicate navigation systems, product functionality and user journeys.Create polished visual designs with supporting component libraries for existing and new products.Build low and high-fidelity prototypes and test with users to get feedback and measure usability.Use active listening skills while facilitating; think on your feet and respond quickly to keep the focus on outcomes.Present design work and articulate design decisions early and often to stakeholders to ensure everyone is on the same page.Advocate for a quality and consistent end-to-end user experience.Collaborate with developers and foster a partnership to get to the best solutions.Be pragmatic and constructively work within the commercial constraints of any project or activity.We would love to hear from you if you have...2-3 years of industry experience in a UX role with a specialism in UI design and experience facilitating HCD activities.You are organised and can plan and manage your time effectively relative to the commercial constraints of a project.Experience working directly with clients and can establish rapport with a range of different stakeholders.A portfolio reflecting a strong design aesthetic and problem-solving skills. Life at AirteamOur main design tools are Miro and Figma, and we use Slack for day-to-day comms and the Atlassian suite for knowledge and task management. Our UX team meet twice weekly. We have a stand-up on Mondays to catch up after the weekend and see what everyone’s working on or needs help with, and a coffee catchup/show-and-tell session on Wednesdays to showcase our work in flight and share interesting problems that might need solving or things that we’ve learned. We also have monthly retrospectives to see how we could evolve our ways of working and plot out improvements in our processes.You’ll also have a monthly one-on-one with Nick (our Head of UX), which will focus on personal and professional goals and supporting you in what you do.Airteam benefits 🎉👉 Flexible working practices for everyone. Set your own start and finish times.🗺️ Location-agnostic pay. We pay for the skills and experience you bring to the role.👩‍👩‍👧 $15,000 support payment for new parents. Covers biological birth and adoption.💻 $1,080 annual laptop allowance, or we’ll ship you a new MacBook Pro.📱 $1,200 annual communication allowance. Covers your internet and mobile plan.🏡 $750 home office allowance. Helping you set up a comfortable workspace, plus an annual $250 top-up.🎓 $2,000 learning budget and 2 days a year towards your personal learning journey.🎓 LUMA certification for all UXer’s - booked in after successful probation. 🚀 We’re working on an Airteam career framework to support growth and promotions within the team.💵 Salary packaging for mobile phones, laptops and superannuation contributions.🪷 Health and wellbeing initiatives. Including wellness plans, flu vax refunds, mental health first aid training and a culture that promotes a healthy work/life balance.☕ Team away days twice a year. A space for collaboration, IRL coffee breaks and a time to get to know each other beyond work.😃 And most importantly, we’re a friendly and inclusive place to be; there are no egos here.Get hired and join usWe want our hiring process to be enjoyable, transparent and fair. Here are the steps we move through if you’d like to apply.Apply online - You need to apply through our website. We have an application form that asks very specific questions related to the role. We review your answers instead of scanning CV’s. To reduce unconscious bias, we review applications with names removed and focus on your competencies and experience.Phone screen - If your answers show the relevant skills and experience required for the role, we’ll call you to have a chat about your application.Design interview - We’ll then arrange a design interview. This may be in person or over zoom. This is where we’ll dig deeper into your experience and get a chance to ask each other lots of questions.Team catchup - a chance to meet someone on the team in person (if it’s possible) or on zoom to talk about life as a UXer at Airteam.Reference checks and offer - Pretty much what it says, we’ll want to call two previous managers for a reference to complete the offer.Important information 👇Unfortunately, we cannot offer sponsorship for this position. Applicants must be in Australia and eligible to work.We are an equal opportunity employer and consider all applicants, including people of different ages, gender, ethnicity, physical ability, sexual orientation, religious belief, work experiences, and educational backgrounds.We prefer not to work with recruiters. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes sent from recruiters. Thanks!

title: User Experience Designer
description:
Hi there! Bapple UX Agency is looking for an experienced UX Designer that has polished interview, research, facilitation and strong wireframing skills. 2+ years of professional client-facing UX design / research experience is a must (University or training projects will not be considered).Full-time —  5 days per week, with a half-day on Fridays (afternoon off for full-timers).You are working remotely from a Sydney location. It's crucial that you're Sydney based! We have regular face-to-face meetings and work activities.Skills we are looking for — You have an exceptional understanding of the UX process for end-to-end web/digital product projects.You will be learning our client's business/user problems and then creating UX artefacts such as: Interviews, Personas, Journey Maps, Workshops, User Flows etc and translate these into IA sitemaps, wireframes, and test-ready prototypes.An empathetic strategic thinker possessing strong written English and verbal communication/presentation skills.A problem solver that listens and asks a lot of whys.A collaborative team player, you share your ideas, insights and knowledge with the team.A graduate of an established UX institution such as Academy XI or General Assembly.Proficiency in Miro, Figma, Sketch, or other design and prototyping tools.Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to the team and our clientsInterest in the research/human behaviour with a keen eye for designPast marketing, UX or design experienceYou love solving real-world problemsWhat you will be doingStakeholder and user interviews, workshopsHeuristic analysis, competitor research, research synthesisProducing UX artefacts: Personas, Epics, user journey maps, flows etcCreating accessible low/mid fidelity wireframes and interactive prototypesUsability testing and synthesisCreating client presentationsWorking with project managers and designers to deliver exciting business-critical digital products and websites.Bonus points for:Bringing something new to the team, what did you do before UX?Having your own portfolio website with detailed UX project examplesHaving solid UI / Visual Design taste (Minimal UI design required in the role)Speaking more than 1 languageBeing a thoroughly good humanPerksMentorship / career growth from UX seniorsHalf-day fridays!Work from homeSocial catchups with the teamSolid agency processAbout us — Bapple is a leading digital UX Agency in Surry Hills, Sydney. We're passionate about great design, the power of UX and the success of our clients.We aim for business-relevant and measurable results. We do this by researching, designing, building and supporting world-class websites, web apps, brands and apps for global clients across Finance, Not For Profit/Charity, SaaS, engineering, eCommerce, Law & more.Culture — Located a step away from Central station (working remotely), we are a friendly team of 10 who enjoy helping businesses grow. We are innovators, artists, writers, avid technologists and we value passionate dedicated people in our team.We aim to do work that we are proud of, and that makes a difference to the businesses and people we serve! Google 'Bapple UX' to see our work.Please apply for this role if you...Are confident that your professional industry experience matches 2-3+ years minimum (University or Education time does not count sorry) and you have worked on apps and web apps.IMPORTANT: Have minimum of 3 examples of recent real industry work (University or training projects will not be considered).Also IMPORTANT: You will not be considered without examples or a portfolio of digital products you have directly contributed to (a personal website is a bonus)Apply today :)

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Tryzens is an international digital commerce agency and our mission is to accelerate client success and growth across all channels, leveraging our expertise, insights, and digital-first principles, to deliver compelling experiences that delight and engage their customers.We are People First and believe that empowered happy people achieve more. We're Customer-Centric and our customers’ growth is our success. We believe that Collaboration and Innovation drive the greatest results and Integrity, Trust & Transparency build lasting relationships. We started in London, but have expanded to have operations in Melbourne, Sydney, Sofia, and Trivandrum with 200+ team members serving 45+ international brands.We are on the lookout for a talented Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team and work across the spectrum of UX / UI on e-commerce-focused websites and applications. This role can be based in either of our locations in either Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane. Tryzens is a hybrid workplace, so we're happy for you to work from our offices or from home.As a Senior UX/UI Designer at Tryzens, you will contribute to the initial discovery and planning phase of projects, collaborating with project managers, business analysts, developers and clients to engage in a range of activities – from user research to producing deliverables such as personas, user journeys, and wireframes right through to final hi-fi designs that are ready for development.It’s a collaborative role where you will have the chance to work closely with developers, business analysts, and of course, the client to craft engaging and high-converting experiences.The type of experience you’ll need should be in these areas:UX audits – reviewing existing sites and content and making justified recommendations on how to make them better, based on usability and eCommerce best practices, and online retail experience.Ability to define customer and business needs: Communicating with clients to gather requirements and advising on UX solutions.Knowledge of different UX research methodologies including qualitative and quantitative research.Working with project managers to help define the plan for the design project to align with scope - being confident about the time required for work and sticking to it.Wireframing, sketching, and prototyping user experiences in tools like Sketch, Figma, and Invision.Be able to produce UX deliverables such as UX audit reports, personas, synthesized insights, competitor analysis, and user journeys/flows.Be able to produce UI deliverables such as Design systems, style guides, and component libraries.Following best practices, usability, and accessibility for online shopping experiences. Keeping up to date with the latest UX trends and best practices.A great understanding of branding. Able to follow brand guidelines and apply them to an online shopping website, but also help clients to better communicate their brand online through the effective use of graphic design and branding principles.Working with task management and timesheet tools like JIRA and Trello.Handoff of annotated designs to developers using predominantly Figma but with some instances of using Zeplin.Quality assurance – reviewing the implementation of design and providing feedback to developers to ensure high-quality delivery to clients.Ideally, you will also have experience in these areas:Talking to and helping manage the relationship with the client.Be comfortable contributing to pitch work and presenting your ideas.Workshopping ideas and co-creating solutions and new ideas with the client.Be able to create customer journeys illustrating the requirements a customer has when facing a specific task, such as finding a product.Have experience working with eCommerce clients – preferred but not mandatory.Understanding benchmarks and best practices.Strong understanding of front-end code (HTML & CSS) to design viable responsive UI designs which utilise the inherent functionality and technology of the eCommerce platform.Be able to prioritise and manage your own time and highlight as soon as possible any ideas that you feel might improve the solution for the client.CRO experience is preferred but not mandatory.RequirementsBeautiful portfolio of digital design preferably in luxury & premium eCommerce brands.Passionate about design and customer experience and always keeping up to date with the latest design and UX trends.Excellent creative problem solver, always trying to come up with the best solution to a problem.A high level of attention to detail and accuracy. You take pride in the quality of your work from the research through to the implementation.Self-motivated and proactive. Keen to learn and continually improve workflow and team productivity, sharing your ideas with the team.Great communication skills for explaining ideas and discussing solutions with developers, clients, and other team members.BenefitsFlexible working hours.Flexibility to work hybrid - either from home or in our offices.Opportunities for training and development.Team social events.2 charity/volunteer days per year.25 annual leave days per employment year.Day off for your birthday.Enhanced parental leave policy.Client discounts.EOFY and Christmas parties each year.More info about Tryzens here: http://tryzens.com/We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity and encourage everyone to respond. Tryzens is an equal opportunity employer and every applicant will be considered without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity.

title: User Experience Designer
description:
UX DesignerAre you a UX Jedi looking to use your design powers for good? Look no Further! We have partnered with some of the best leading brands in the industry, who are seeking a UX Designer to join their team of rebels and change the world (or at least, change how people interact with their products).As a UX Designer on the team, you'll have the chance to flex your creative muscles and make a real impact on the user experience of digital products. This role requires a highly experienced understanding of digital disciplines and UX methodologies and uses that knowledge to lead in the development of designs through research, analytics, workflow diagrams, sketches, interactive prototypes, and useability testing/insights.You'll work closely with the product development team to understand business and technical requirements and translate them into intuitive and efficient designs.You will be at the forefront of shaping how users interact with products.What we are looking for:You will be a Master of Design tools like Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, or Figma.You will have a strong portfolio showcasing your ability to create mind-blowing user-centered designs.Education in a related course, preferably undergraduate or greater,and at least 3 years of professional experience as a UX Designer is preferred.You’re a great communicator. You have the communication skills to help set upframeworks and brainstorm initial design concepts.You appreciate big picture thinking. While details are everything, creating anexperience that always keeps users in mind is equally as important.Most importantly, we're looking for someone who is passionate about making a difference through design and excited to join an innovative and forward-thinking team.If this sounds like you, then we would LOVE to hear from you.For more information, please apply to this role and we will be in touch or alternatively send your resume to design@thedrivegroup.com.au.Follow Us On LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup For The Latest Tech News, New Jobs & Our $1000 'Introduce A Friend' Referral Feehttps://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup For The Latest Tech News, New Jobs & Our $1000 'Introduce A Friend' Referral Fee

We started in London, but have expanded to have operations in Melbourne, Sydney, Sofia, and Trivandrum with 200+ team members serving 45+ international brands.We are on the lookout for a talented Senior UX/UI Designer to join our team and work across the spectrum of UX / UI on e-commerce-focused websites and applications. This role can be based in either of our locations in either Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane. Tryzens is a hybrid workplace, so we're happy for you to work from our offices or from home.As a Senior UX/UI Designer at Tryzens, you will contribute to the initial discovery and planning phase of projects, collaborating with project managers, business analysts, developers and clients to engage in a range of activities – from user research to producing deliverables such as personas, user journeys, and wireframes right through to final hi-fi designs that are ready for development.It’s a collaborative role where you will have the chance to work closely with developers, business analysts, and of course, the client to craft engaging and high-converting experiences.The type of experience you’ll need should be in these areas:UX audits – reviewing existing sites and content and making justified recommendations on how to make them better, based on usability and eCommerce best practices, and online retail experience.Ability to define customer and business needs: Communicating with clients to gather requirements and advising on UX solutions.Knowledge of different UX research methodologies including qualitative and quantitative research.Working with project managers to help define the plan for the design project to align with scope - being confident about the time required for work and sticking to it.Wireframing, sketching, and prototyping user experiences in tools like Sketch, Figma, and Invision.Be able to produce UX deliverables such as UX audit reports, personas, synthesized insights, competitor analysis, and user journeys/flows.Be able to produce UI deliverables such as Design systems, style guides, and component libraries.Following best practices, usability, and accessibility for online shopping experiences. Keeping up to date with the latest UX trends and best practices.A great understanding of branding. Able to follow brand guidelines and apply them to an online shopping website, but also help clients to better communicate their brand online through the effective use of graphic design and branding principles.Working with task management and timesheet tools like JIRA and Trello.Handoff of annotated designs to developers using predominantly Figma but with some instances of using Zeplin.Quality assurance – reviewing the implementation of design and providing feedback to developers to ensure high-quality delivery to clients.Ideally, you will also have experience in these areas:Talking to and helping manage the relationship with the client.Be comfortable contributing to pitch work and presenting your ideas.Workshopping ideas and co-creating solutions and new ideas with the client.Be able to create customer journeys illustrating the requirements a customer has when facing a specific task, such as finding a product.Have experience working with eCommerce clients – preferred but not mandatory.Understanding benchmarks and best practices.Strong understanding of front-end code (HTML & CSS) to design viable responsive UI designs which utilise the inherent functionality and technology of the eCommerce platform.Be able to prioritise and manage your own time and highlight as soon as possible any ideas that you feel might improve the solution for the client.CRO experience is preferred but not mandatory.RequirementsBeautiful portfolio of digital design preferably in luxury & premium eCommerce brands.Passionate about design and customer experience and always keeping up to date with the latest design and UX trends.Excellent creative problem solver, always trying to come up with the best solution to a problem.A high level of attention to detail and accuracy. You take pride in the quality of your work from the research through to the implementation.Self-motivated and proactive. Keen to learn and continually improve workflow and team productivity, sharing your ideas with the team.Great communication skills for explaining ideas and discussing solutions with developers, clients, and other team members.BenefitsFlexible working hours.Flexibility to work hybrid - either from home or in our offices.Opportunities for training and development.Team social events.2 charity/volunteer days per year.25 annual leave days per employment year.Day off for your birthday.Enhanced parental leave policy.Client discounts.EOFY and Christmas parties each year.More info about Tryzens here: http://tryzens.com/We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity and encourage everyone to respond. Tryzens is an equal opportunity employer and every applicant will be considered without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity.

title: Product Designer
description:
Company DescriptionAfterpay is transforming the way we pay by allowing customers to buy products immediately and pay for their purchases over four installments. The service is completely free⁵ for customers who pay on time - helping people spend responsibly. As of December 31, 2021, Afterpay is offered by more than 122,000 of the world’s favorite retailers and more than 19 million active customers have adopted the service.Afterpay is currently available in Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the United States and the United Kingdom, France, Italy and Spain, where it is known as Clearpay. Afterpay is on a mission to power an economy in which everyone wins. Afterpay is a wholly owned subsidiary of Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ).Job DescriptionThe product designer team in Afterpay is responsible for: determining the right approach to execute strategy, balancing short and long-term goals and priorities, developing alignment with cross-functional partners, and presenting work in design critiques and leadership reviews. This is a cross-functional role where you will work with other designers, product managers, analysts and engineers.As a product designer you will be responsible for planning, executing and shipping your work to millions of merchants across the Afterpay x Square x Cash App ecosystem. You will be paired with a Lead Product Designer in an environment tailored around your growth and development.You will:create your own idea using existing design systems and standards; provide insights for improvement when necessaryActing as a product parter, interpret data and informed design decisions based on both qualitative and quantitative insightsActing as a product parter, collaborate effectively with your peer and guide the vision for our cross functional stakeholders; Lead with the voice of the customer and have a deep understanding of human centered design principlesQualificationsYou have:At least (2-4) years of relevant professional experienceA portfolio that shows work you were directly responsible for with little guidance from leadershipExperience as a primary contributor to continuous streams of workFor consideration, please submit a link to your portfolio and any relevant passwordsAdditional InformationWe’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, based solely on the core competencies required of the role at hand, and without regard to any legally protected class.We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page. PerksWe want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes:Healthcare coverageRetirement PlansEmployee Stock Purchase ProgramWellness perksPaid parental leavePaid time offLearning and Development resourcesBlock, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

title: Product Designer
description:
Company DescriptionGumtree Australia is Australia’s favourite local marketplace connecting buyers and sellers in the local community to buy, sell and find just about everything. There are more than 3 million listings across hundreds of categories and 80,000 new ads are posted every single day.On average, more than 6 million Australians visit Gumtree each month, and we’re proud to say we’re one of the top shopping apps in Australia. Facilitating successful and safe local trade is our main priority. Our mission is to empower people and create economic opportunity and to be Australia’s favourite local marketplace for all of life’s needs.Job DescriptionOur design team is responsible for the full product design cycle including strategy, research, design, prototyping and testing. Our team members value the ambitious spirit, the “can-do” attitude, and their mutual respect’s talent and contribution.As a Product Designer, you’ll be working with multiple product squads focusing on our strategic categories, including Pets and Cars. You’ll be responsible for every aspect of the product design process, from conceiving initiatives, strategising, researching, designing, to testing and working with multidisciplinary teams to efficiently identify opportunities, and craft product solutions that are feasible to the business and intuitive to our customers.What You Will Be DoingWork with a cross functional team including product managers, engineers, and other specialists in the business to ensure product features are efficiently crafted and launched.You will provide hands-on delivery of design assets across all channels, such as concepts, wireframes, prototypes and user interface designs with tools including but not limited to Figma, Miro and Adobe CS.Plan and conduct customer research using human-centred design methods (Quantitative & Qualitative) and techniques to uncover problems, and unknown customer needs.Facilitate design discussions and workshops.Contribute to the product strategy and visionQualificationsYou have 3+ years working with product and tech teams.Bachelor's degree in design or similarProven experience working with marketplaces or eCommerce platforms will be highly beneficial to our teamExcellent problem-solving skills and familiarity with technical constraints and limitations as they apply to design for platforms such as desktop and mobile (i.e. Android and iOS).You have experience facilitating the discovery of opportunitiesYou’re experienced using existing design systems, as well as building and maintaining them.You use qualitative and quantitative data as part of your processAdditional InformationWhat we offer:Competitive compensation including generous paid parental leaveFree health insuranceAllocated training budgetHybrid workingFantastic team cultureInterested?From the moment that you join the Gumtree team we aspire to make your employment experience an awesome and engaging one. If you are enthusiastic and thrive in a collaborative and friendly environment, then apply and send us your CV!

title: Product Designer
description:
About UsFuturerent is a fast-growing fintech startup based in Sydney that gives property investors their rent in advance — the simplest and fastest way to access up to $100,000.There is A$48bn p.a. in residential rent in Australia stuck in monthly rent cycles. We’re helping the 2.2 million Australian property investors unlock their rent in advance, to finance renovations, property purchases and a range of other investments.Futurerent is entering the scaleup stage of its journey to radically transform how property investors collect rent and access the money they need to grow their wealth. Until now, most property investors have refinanced their entire loan when they only need a small amount, which is slow, painful and expensive. The banks make borrowing $50,000 as painful as borrowing $500,000. Futurerent has created a new fit-for-purpose financing solution for property investors which unlocks the money they need, without borrowing more money from the bank.There has been some buzz about Futurerent, we have been featured in the AFR, Domain, Australian Property Investor Magazine and Your Investment PropertyRequirementsYou have3-5+ years of relevant industry experience designing digital applications, experiences, websites, products and/or services that balance user needs, business objectives and technological constraintsExperience tackling large, complex and systemic pieces of workAn inclusive and proactive approach to working with cross-functional teamsYou willFlex your creative design muscles to help shape the core product and guidelines for our customersOwn the design improvement of products by bringing our product to lifeHave the ability to speak to and build empathy with our customers Apply the human-centred design approach to a variety of projectsCreate frameworks such as customer journeys, service blueprints or ecosystem maps based on inputs from researchDesign wireframes, user flow diagrams and application mapsCreate and test interactive prototypes Design and run experiments to validate product and interaction hypotheses What success looks likeIn the first month, you will form a deep understanding of our clients, business and objectives and consider these factors in the context of the current and historical designs. You will immediately dive into some of the ‘easier wins’, where you can flex your creative muscle to move the needle and start considering some of the longer term design challenges.In the second month, you will take wireframes and transform them into beautiful production-ready designs.In the next few months, you will dive deeper into the design of new products and new portals currently under development, and play an integral role in the GTM strategy.While working on the website and product design, you will also work closely with marketing to create beautiful assets, collateral and visual content.The teamWe are a tight-knit team of specialists with deep experience in property, finance, marketing, communications and technology. We thrive on first principles and are always coming back to the ‘why’ to drive innovation and optimisation. We believe that by leveraging each other’s core competencies and combining our unique insights and skills we are building a world-class business that will have a meaningful impact on the wealth creation possibilities for thousands of everyday Australian families.You will find that your fellow Futurerent colleagues are superstar performers and team players with a growth mindset who love building an innovative business and value transparency, simplicity and relationships. As a key member of the leadership team, we want you to feel empowered and for Futurerent to be a meaningful part of your own wealth creation journey. We are open to relocating a candidate to Sydney.BenefitsWe are a tight-knit team with a culture of responsibility and accountability, we believe that Futurerent employees are able to build their own realms, and we are all about continuous learning. You will find that your fellow Futurerent colleagues have values based on humility, respect and are open to change. As a Futurerent employee, we want you to feel empowered.We believe that diversity is critical to our success. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

title: User Experience Designer
description:
About UsPrograma is a Melbourne-based early-stage venture-backed startup seeking to revolutionize the interior design, architecture and furniture industry through an end-to-end SaaS-enabled marketplace. Programa makes it easier for designers to manage their projects and for suppliers to manage, promote and sell their products.After launching in September 2021 Programa has grown quickly and now has users in 30+ countries managing thousands of projects.Job DescriptionAs our first full-time UX Designer you'll be leading the produt design process across and working closely with the founders and our passionate users. We're building a big product that solves big problems for a big industry and you'll be in the centre of the business.You'll have understanding of product strategy, UI and UX design conventions, a keen eye for pixel perfection and and be passionate about shipping great product.About You3+ years of experience with the end-to-end product design processA portfolio that demonstrates experience in product thinking where you have previously shipped UX/UI design for digital productsProduct strategy - You will work closely with our product team to build product strategies and influence product development across ideation and launchYou're excited by regularly coming up with new features and ideas, and love to ship new products and features that help our usersYou're organised and love well considered product design that results in great UX and happy usersYou love working with the broader team, including founders, engineers, product developers, users and everyone else involved with bringing ideas to lifeHave deep empathy for our customers' pain points and needs through qualitative and quantitative research (surveys, interviews, and product usage), and develop solutions to meet those needsYou are a problem solver that’s excited by a challenge. You enjoy sitting in a room and whiteboarding ideas to confidently come up with simple, elegant solutions that everyone can move forward withNot be afraid of getting hands-on and working quickly within a small teamYou're passionate about our users and enjoy combinign this with research and data analysisYou enjoy a little flexibility in your work. Our growth means there are constantly new things to work on every day, as such it’s likely that you’ll often be working across the board on new and exciting projectsEven BetterA Figma expertSalary & BenefitsCompetitive salaryWe are currently a small team and seeking someone with the personal drive, motivation, and enthusiasm to join us in growing a global business from the very beginning.Programa’s office is located in the thriving hub of Cremorne, Melbourne and close to cafes, restaurants, train stations, gyms and parks.
